Comments: Loved this trail!  It's short but I went early and had the falls to myself and I just loved how the water cascaded over the rocks and it's definitely a unique waterfall worth seeing.  I agree that this is a friendly hike for all ages so long as little ones aren't climbing up the rock scramble at the end.
Popular trail with lots of people. Great short and easy hike for kids and beginning hikers.

Very Easy hike, even if you have to park on the main road instead of the smaller lot by the bathrooms. Because of this it is always a really busy hike. Some think the waterfall is a let down, and even though it’s smaller I’ve never seen another like it. Great hike with even small kids.

You can either park by the highway or take the road all the way up to the trail, but the parking by the trail fills up quick! We liked the extra walk to the trailhead, even if it's all on a gradual incline. The trail itself starts out a bit steep, but eventually levels out. The trail is very pretty, mostly shaded, and you cross at least one stream before you end at the stream by the falls. There is a sign that warns to not climb the rocks of the waterfall, but there were a lot of people that ignored it despite the slippery rocks. Overall, very easy trail, nice views of forest and nearby mountains, and plenty of signage and obvious pathways to make sure you don't accidentally veer off course. The water of the stream was low enough by the waterfall that we could cross over and get closer without getting our shoes wet! The rocks are slippery though, so be careful, especially on the small climb down to the stream itself.

The trail itself was very easy and well shaded so you can go any time of the day and be fine. The parking lot fills really fast and if you have to park out on the street it could add about 1 mile total to the trail. When we got there the river was pretty full you can walk across it but you should bring some water shoes or your feet will get soaked!
Too many people and the waterfall itself wasn’t much to speak of. Would recommend picking a different trail.

We started a little after 7am and it was not too crowded yet. Nice and cool the entire time and the sun was still not in the canyon. 

Nice short hike for nearly any skill level. 

If you want to see the waterfall going into the donut hole you have to climb down a little 5-10 foot rock face and then hike up the river/waterfall. You will need to step on stones and logs to not get your shoes wet. You also will have to climb up the waterfall that is pretty slippery and might not be for everyone. You can kinda see it from the bottom but not as good as the top. I took my sons 8 and 6 and went to the top. I had to help the 6 year old a few times with the climbing and river crossings. 

I’ll be back with more family members next time for sure. We loved it.
It was okay! There was a lot of people though! To hike to the falls part, we all had to take turns climbing up there and seeing the waterfall up close. It was a quick easy hike though

Easy hike that is perfect for families or for something quick when there isn’t much time. Minimal incline for the first half the loop, then flat the rest of the way. Definitely recommend parking at Mill D rather than the trailhead lot to get a bit more distance. Plus, the views are awesome walking to the trailhead
Super fun trail. But way way crowded on a Sunday! In the summer wear hiking sandals. In the winter time wear crampons
Great easy hike, worth especially if you are staying in SLC, only about 20 minutes from Sugar House.  Waterfalls are gorgeous!!!
1.0 mile each way out and back. Easy trail filled with pines. Saw a female moose. Kid friendly.
Saw three big moose on the trail today!

Love this trail! It’s a short, super easy hike to the falls, which are beautiful. You can choose to hike up the rocks that make up the falls to see the actual “donut” which is highly suggest. It gets packed, but worth it. They give out parking tickets, so don’t park where you shouldn’t!

Really cool waterfall, although very crowded once you get closer to the waterfall. A bit of a scramble to get to the top of the falls. Unfortunately there is a lot of trash on the trail, stop littering people!

Fun family hike. Easily accessible, so it's often very busy.
Sad to see so much graffiti along the trail right now. Many signs, benches, and trees have been defaced. Ugh.
This was a beautiful easy hike and nice waterfall!

Donut Falls Trail was a pleasant hike! I was anticipating it being quite a bit longer (I doubt it was 3 miles), but wonder if it’s taking into account the distance from the further parking lot. We got there a little before 8am and there was plenty of parking by the trailhead but it filled up not long after. We were very cold. I think it would have been more enjoyable when the sun was over the mountains, but can see how high volumes of traffic would be a deterrent. The rocks leading up to the waterfall were very slick (as evidenced by the sign telling you not to go up them). I would not recommend doing it alone or bringing young children. We saw more than one person slip and fall into the freezing water.

This is a very popular trail with a lot of families, so if you're looking for solitude, this isn't the hike for you. There are two parking areas, the larger being off the canyon road with a .50 mile walk on pavement to the trailhead and second parking area which is typically full. At the trailhead sign there are are two trails, the one to left is a more difficult terrain but they both lead to the falls. There is A LOT of traffic at the falls and to reach the top requires scaling slippery steep rock. Plan on getting wet feet if you want to get close to the falls.
Nice family friendly trail. There is a lot of foot traffic however. Bring shoes that you don’t mind getting wet and muddy. You will have to climb up/down some rocks and walk through the water.

Really easy hike with very rewarding views. My friends and I climbed to the top of the waterfall and went into the donut. I ran through the waterfall and it was so fun!! It took us about 2 hours, but we spent a lot of time at the waterfall. I will definitely do this one again.
Awesome hike today!! Lots of chipmunks on the trail!

really pretty hike, we went to the bottom and then the top! I didn't realize theres a rope to use to climb into the donut. not sure I would've anyway! :) pretty and good workout but not hard at all. easy hike!
This is a great family trail! The waterfall is awesome and our kids loved it! I would for sure take them back and do it again. You will get wet so have water shoes.

This trail is great! It is beautiful the whole way there and ends in a beautiful waterfall. It is a little sad that many people that are on this trail don't respect the wildlife or the rules. When you arrive there is parking right at the trailhead after driving through a dirt road, but if the parking lot is full you can park by the main road. There is a bathroom at the beginning of the trail. There isn't any swimming or wading because it is a watershed, but sadly a lot of people don't follow this rule. When you are almost to the falls there is a point where the trail forks. The left trail goes to the bottom of the falls and the right goes up above past some private property signs and above the donut part of the waterfall. Our 9 and 7 year olds were fine the whole way up. Be careful! The rocks can be slippery.

If you are the type of person who likes solitude this is not hike for you. It was very crowded. We were lucky to be able to park near the parking lot and not out on the main road. Most of the hike is easy - our four-year-old twins did it without any problems. We made it to the base of the falls but the final scramble up the rocks was far too crowded and slippery to take young kids. So we are unable to see the donut part of Donut Falls. I would definitely recommend trying this hike early in the morning midweek but not during peak weekend hours. Also if you have little kids and want to go up to the donut you probably need an adult for each child. There are many other awesome hikes in the area that I would choose before this one.

I had high hopes for this trail. I'm not a hiker, and quite out of shape... but this app rates trails like Silver Lake Loop easy... and this trail in the same 'easy' category. This trail is quite an inclined, rocks and roots cover much of the trail. This trail should be rated hard if for no other reason that to complete the hike, and get the picture pay off, you've got to climb straight up huge SLIPPERY boulders.
We drove up to the parking at the base of the hike so we didn’t have to hike the road. The trail was beautiful and we loved the falls. There is high traffic but not on the second side of the loop.
So much fun! Didn’t realize there was parking near the trail head. Got a little muddy but worth it!

8/7/19 Definitely an easy hike to get to the falls. But I would say to actually climb to the donut part you need to have an adult with a kid younger than 8. My boy who is 10 made it up super easy without help. Today however we went when it was a bit rainy. Water is freezing!  But the view was amazing. Definitely worth the numb feet! :)

8/7/2019 You’re not going to believe this, but we had Donut Falls to ourselves!  We went this morning and got a great parking spot at the trailhead around 8:30am.  We saw hikers coming down, but during our actual time in the Donut cave  and climbing down the falls, we had the place entirely to ourselves—not a soul in sight until we were away from the falls.  Such a beautiful hike on an overcast morning.  My 11 year old son with autism made the climb to the donut hole and back down (which is really the tricky part) and is so proud of himself.  My 9 year old guy has done it 4 times now easy peasy.  Gotta know the trail and your kids’ abilities though.  Being inside the cave where the water comes through is a thrill, and the water is still super high this year.  Love this hike!
Busy trail, but still a nice trail
Quick hike that’s mainly kid friendly. Need water shoes to get to the waterfall but a pretty hike even without the water shoes
Very easy trail

Very beautiful hike. Trail is well maintained and signs to help with direction of the trail. We saw a deer while on the hike as well. At the waterfall we decided to hike up the rocks of the waterfall to get up to the actual donut fall. Would definitely not recommend that section for kids. Get there before 9am if you’d like to try and beat the crowd. We parked at the bottom near the main road, but there is a parking areas farther up that fills fast.
Really easy hike, good for kids, they loved climbing up the falls.

Super short hike, but the kids loved treading through the water and scrabbling up the rocks to the falls. BE SURE TO BRING WATER SHOES! There is no way to get up to the falls without getting your feet wet. And honestly that’s the best part of the whole trail.
short and sweet! Took my 12 and 9 yr old no problems. Very pretty
Beautiful, completely kid- family friendly but maybe a little too much so.  Pretty large groups of families and camp groups making the hiking not as relaxing.
Very busy, but the short hike to the falls is quick and easy!
super trial...
Great trail, hikers with poor attitude and etiquete. I saw people littering and walking dogs when it explicitly says “no dogs allowed” definitely don’t recommend it if you like quiet, peaceful hikes.

The hike was easy and not bad at all. I’m a little bummed because all the photos I saw online made it seem like it was this big waterfall and cave you could stand under but it’s pretty small. You do have to like rock climb a little and walk through the river to see the fall. I would do again, and it’s easy, just online was misleading a little bit.
great quick trail. Super busy but worth it.
Short easy hike with big rewards.

Definitely an easy, but rewarding hike! Your feet will get wet if you decide to hike to the top of the waterfall, but it was worth it!! Only gave it 4 stars because of the amount of other people on the trail, heavily trafficked.

beautiful wildflowers and grasses. truly gorgeous hike. took 50 minutes from the first parking lot by the Hwy up past the waterfall. only thing I didn't live was the masses of somewhat unfriendly hikers....
Easy hike, well covered, with high payoff. Make sure you hike into the grotto where the falls enter the rock.
A little bit harder than we anticipated for our grandparents hiking with us but a fun trail! Up at the top you have to hike across some slippery rocks and down a tricky part. Wear water shoes.
More of a stroll than a hike I’d say but fun nonetheless!
Beautiful trail and easy for kids, I took ages 9,7,5 and carried the toddler in a pack. Highly recommended.
Love this trail for snowshoeing. Take some micro spikes for a scramble to the falls- so cool to see when everything is frozen over!

We definitely took the wrong way. Got a nice view of the falls from above, though. There isn’t a real end destination for the trail, the waterfall is just kind of there. We brought donuts but there was no room to sit and eat, though.
It was pretty but waaay too crowded.
Took my 4 year old and 2 year old. It was beautiful!
A nice, easy hike meandering through a pine forest. The falls are picturesque but even on a Monday it’s quite crowded.
Nice easy fun hike. Heavily trafficked. Good for kids.
Absolutely beautiful
so very crowded,  too busy! beautiful and lots of shade.
simple hike with kids but overloaded with people. Still a very beautiful hike.

The snow has melted and you can all the way to the donut. If you wear good shoes and be mindful of the water. It is moving fast and gets deep in some parts. Kids can go most of the way, but I would only take teenagers all the way to the donut. Love this hike!

Hiked this trail over the 4th of July weekend. It was super crowded. Surprised we found a parking at the trailhead.  Beautiful easy hike. To get to the actual donut falls you’ll have to scramble over & through big wet rocks at the end. Be prepared to get your feet wet. I kept my younger kids behind as the water flow was pretty heavy . It was nerve wrecking watching  the rest of our party climb up the rocks to the donut.
Nice easy hike for the kids.

did the trail June 29th 2019.
I have done the trail many times and on Saturday water was the highest I have ever seen.  good hike but be careful

Love this hike. But even though it's Monday afternoon it's still pretty busy and we ended up having to hike in from the highway cuz I've seen cars being ticketed in the past that have parked off the side of the road near the parking lot. The water is still pretty cold and I didn't feel like it was safe enough for my 11 and 9 year olds to hike to the top of the falls cuz the river is still moving pretty quick but it was still awesome and worth the hike

The map says to start from the main highway for the 3 mile loop. We walked up a paved road for about .5 mile and realized you can just drive all the way up to the actual trail head by the bathroom and park for free. We didn’t mind the extra exercise as the trail to the falls is pretty easy but would have been nice to know. The falls were flowing high. The  main trail leads down to the river bed. You can hardly see the actual donut and to see it closer you’d have to scramble pretty much up the face of the waterfall. We found some side trails that led up the mountain a ways. The trail was small and strap but doable but even at the very top, we were still too far away to get a very good look at the donut. A fun hike with different difficulty levels depending on what your goal is for the day. We would come back probably later in the season when the water is lower to get a bit closer to the falls without being swept away. Overall a fun hike just up the canyons with beautiful scenery and quiet environment.

Hiked on 5-22. The main trail is pretty easy and scenic. Getting next to the Donut is a little tricky due to the heavy water flow. We climbed the side of the mountain to try to get to the donut (more difficult). There are several very steep descent paths we tried (be careful).  We found the right one and were able to get to the donut. The water was flowing too hard to go underneath the donut.
One of my favorite hikes! The river levels were high so you couldn't easily get to right under the falls.

LOVE this trail!! I have done this hike twice in the last 2 weeks with my baby in my pack. It is easy enough for the whole family to enjoy. There is a tiny scramble over some rocks in order to get to the falls, but it's fairly easy.

Falls is raging! Read some reviews before going so I was prepared with my water shoes and it’s a good thing I did! Was able to climb up and get in the cave but water was above my knees and freezing, but very worth getting in. Love this hike!

Just did this today, it’s one of my favorite spots to hike to. You’ve gotta get your feet in the river if you want to climb up to the donut cave, and the water is super cold but it’s totally worth it. The water is moving pretty quick, but it’s doable if you watch your step. Saw some patches of snow up past the cave, but not much at all, should be gone within the next week or two.

Good hike! The trail gets rather treacherous high up - muddy, snow patches, steep and rocky. I took the shady route up but on the way down I stayed along the creek instead of crossing back over the little bridge, it was nice! The falls are flowing really strong still so there's no getting as close to the "donut" as you usually would be able to this time of year.

This trail is a great and easy! Perfect for a simple day hike. The water is running pretty high so you can’t quite make it to the sign but still a pretty view of the river and falls. We even saw a moose on our last time up!

some snow and muddy spots. wet feet and so much fun. cool temperatures and great views. water moving fast, so be smart.
took my 3 and 5 year old grandsons. they hiked it all the way and back. 
exceptional family hike.

Currently the trail has some muddy spots but passable.  

Easy 2 mile round trip hike to the falls (from bathrooms at the dirt trailhead).  4 miles round trip from the major road if you walk all the way in.  Great place for photos.  Not good for people who may have a hard time climbing or steep hills.

First hike with my 6 & 8 year old and we loved it! Pretty easy hike with a great payoff at the end. There's a pretty steep part right before the falls, but it's not too bad. It was early June and the water was running fast so we couldn't get all the way up. We'll be back later in the year when the water isn't running as fast.
Fun little hike. It is still a little muddy and slick. Crazy busy!!!!
Easy hike lots of traffic
great, pretty, shady
This is a great hike and totally worth the waterfall!! I would rate this trail moderate, though, because there are some pretty technical spots.
a bit slippery, but the perfect hike to start the season.
Short trail, lots of people & the waterfall at the end that you can climb

6/7/19–3:32pm: I’ve attempted this hike twice and just can’t seem to  make it to the falls! Today, the weather was beautiful. Temperature was moderate and there was a small breeze, perfect for this hike. The trail was muddy almost from the start and there was quite a bit of snow up the entire trail. Saw a small garden snake at the trail head. The first bridge is covered by small fallen trees and water so we had to walk around on the snow. When we finally got to the fork that goes down to the river, we discovered that the water was WAY to high to take that path. It’s flowing really fast right now and the lower trail next to the River is completely covered. We tried the alternative route above and we decided that there was too much snow to trek through. We ended up turning around, and decided to try again a bit later in the season! Always a good hike though. Beautiful sights to see!
one of my favorite hikes. its suoer pretty in the winter.
Great easy hike, very muddy.

Super easy hike that can be done in an hour with kids.  Getting to the falls requires climbing on some rocks toward the end, but it's an easy climb.  If you're an experienced hiker looking for a challenge you'll be disappointed.  if you're a very casual hiker looking for a quick morning or afternoon trip you'll have a great time.
Hiked this so many times I could probs do it blindfolded. The river is roaring this time of year so be careful!!

Great trail leading to a waterfall. It's muddy and there is quite a bit of snow still out. Wear shoes with good grip or you'll be sliding all over the place. You have to climb some rocks and get into the water to get to the donut hole.

We brought a dry pair of shoes and socks for afterwards 
My 14 year old son got his feet wet at the falls but I stayed safe and dry 
Even though there’s snow and some mud here and there -it’s packed down and you just avoid the mud no big deal!
I thought I’d be cold and wasn’t at all
Prepare to get your feet wet and muddy. Beautiful hike.

We did this trail yesterday. It's easy to find, and marked well. My four year old made it to the point where you can see the falls but getting right up to them is a bit too tricky for the young ones. Bring extra socks and shoes for when you get done if you plan on getting very close. It's beautiful though, and worth the wet feet!

Friday 5/31/19 1.30-3pm 60's & sunny. First 0.75 miles is up road (paved then dirt) thru a few private residences. Then left branch of trail goes thru mud, packed snow, and stream. At the end you are walking in stream to base of falls with snow all around.  gorgeous. lots of people of all ages, footwear (flip-flops!), and clothing (swimsuits!).  Great bang for the buck. After doing Grandeur Peak in the AM this was a good ending for the day.
A good bit of snow still on the path but it's pretty packed down so walking on it wasn't hard. Wear ok shoes and you should be fine. Beautiful hike with an awesome ending.
Trail is in decent condition. Expect slick spots, slushy areas and depending on shoes the potential for wet feet. We made it all the way to the donut hole.

This is an absolutely beautiful trail. There is lots of snow still the farther in you get so be prepared. Poles aren’t necessary unless you want to climb up the waterfall. Climbing up the waterfall is a little dangerous at times and slippery. Poles would be useful but it can be done without. Beautiful at the top!

Hiked it yesterday, Expect slush, and mud. Decent amount of snow still, but its pretty packed down. We saw a ton of hikers in saddles and flip flops somehow finish the hike. If they can do it, anyone can.
Still a lot of snow, prepare yourselves for crossing the river and a steep snowy slippery section when close to the waterfall.
slippery. cave covered in snow. bring spikes. beautiful tho!
Amazing day...

UGH every time I go, it's snowed out!! Would NOT recommend going now. Once you get to the falls, it's dangerous to hike up to the donut part. You can, but I tried with hiking boots and poles and kept falling. The snow is melting and hollow and slippery, so you don't know when you'll slip or fall through.
Bring spikes it’s still pretty slippery as of May 11! It’s beautiful and nice temp but still a lot of snow.
Nice short hike. Snow on trail most of the way as of May 6th but certainly doable without spikes or poles. Nice hike.
Road to trailhead was closed.. added another mile or so... still not bad, lots of snow still. But beUTAHful hike. Quiet and peaceful right now
If hiking with snow follow the trail between the two private properties! It is gorgeous and worth the hike!

Hiked this trail for the first time (on April 28) and there was still lots of snow. There were a few slippery parts but for the most part, it was easy to follow the tracks on the snow to the waterfall. You can see a tiny bit of the waterfall through the snow but if you're looking for a great waterfall experience, I'd wait till more snow has melted.

Great trail! I hiked this trail end of April and there was still a lot of snow. I don’t recommend this trail to kids. It’s not exactly an easy trail as the whole trail (aside from the mile hike to the trail head) was on snow. When we got to the falls it was a slippery hike up and we pretty much slid down on our bottoms to go back down. All and all it was a very fun hike in the snow.
Easy hike. Even in the snow. Since it’s so popular it’s pretty packed down and easy to follow. Still suggest boots over sneakers when there’s snow.

STAY TO THE RIGHT. When you get to the bathrooms, go right. If you go to the left you’ll add like an extra 35 minutes that are completely unnecessary. (Learn from my mistakes) Great shorter ish hike! This time of year it was all snow and a little slushy but the views were great and getting to crawl down into the falls on the ice and snow was pretty fun! Also don’t wear sneakers. You’ll regret it.
Did a group hike and it was nice but a little early-due to the snow!

I absolutely love this hike for a short and fresh breath of air! Very snowy, very icy. The frozen fall is stunning, and with yak tracks or poles it’s very easy to reach the top of the falls, as well as have a smooth hike.
Great for snowshoeing!

Very different hike in the snow. It was beautiful! The snow right now is packed pretty well, but slick in some places so if you don't want to bring snowshoes wear shoes with good tread. There are little to no directions once you are on the trail, it's easy to get lost and I met 3 groups who gave up. Once you reach the trail head, head right towards and past the bathrooms. If you are hiking in the snow, the trail forks after going uphill for a while, STAY LEFT! After a short jaunt later it looks like it forks again, STAY LEFT. You're almost there at this point! You'll go down a small steep hill into the ravine. Stay to the right. The falls are in front of you after a few feet, you just can't see them, they are covered in snow. You have to climb up a super steep hill covered in snow. In the summer time, this hill is the rocky stream leading up to the falls, but in winter, just a snowy climb. The cave entrance is at the top. Slide down into it and enjoy!
great hike,  late March and tons of snow.

The trail was very therapeutic is the best way to describe it. Easy trail and very beautiful scenery along the way. It was was interesting how the scenery went from normal to a forest. The donut falls area was very nice, we sat for snacks and enjoyed the view when we reached the top.
beautiful trail!

Love this trail in the summer and the winter. A bit icy this last time but that is to be expected. Quiet and calm hike. Snow does sink in some areas but not bad if you stick close to the trail. Beautiful!

I have been to Donut falls in the summer and the Winter.  We hiked it March 16th.  In the winter the snow is packed down enough that you don't need snowshoes. Some people were wearing tennis shoes.  We wore our snow pants, hoodies and snow boots.  I am glad I wore waterproof boots because when you get to the top and go in the falls you can walk through the shallow water under the falls.  The hike is easy and beautiful.  In the summer you will have to climb up some rocks to go into the falls.  I recommend going in both the summer and the winter.
great hike very pretty with all the snow. easy to follow the snow packed trail
Easy hike.  Go early in the week and you miss the crowd.  Had the cave to ourselves for an hour.

Fairly easy trail. Beautiful scenery. The only thing that sucks is you can not bring dogs on trail. You can be fined. The actual falls are pretty as well. I would suggest hiking to the very top to see the donut hole.
Melissa, BCC is a watershed. Domestic dogs can carry communicable disease and are not allowed.
We cant take dogs on this hike on leashes at all times? Doesn't make sense to me. Can anyone confirm this?

Got lost due to never having hiked here before (when the path forks, go left!) But we figured it out eventually, and it was definitely worth the extra effort! The waterfall is very beautiful in winter, and sliding down into the cave is a lot of fun. Had microspikes but they’re not necessary, I did appreciate them at the top though when it got steep. Hiked 3/1/19.
Loved it! Easy winter hike with great snow pack! Bring a sled! We used our coats to slide downhill for fun! Reward at the end with a Alice in wonderland hole to a beautiful unique waterfall!

Great hike on a snowy day. This was one of the more unique hikes I’ve done. Definitely bring showshoes and poles  the trail is covered in pretty loose snow. The last ~100-150 feet involved a bit of scrambling. You have to crawl down into a small hole into a cave to view the falls.
Good views!
1-30-19. I made it up to the falls. It was a bit slippery at the top if you dont have the correct shoes. You need to park by the road making it a 3 mile round trip.

01 19 19 tried hiking this trailer based on the most reset reviews. absolutely CANT MAKE IT WITHOUT SNOWSHOES. kept sinking to my waste each time I tried to get up. will try again next week with snowshoes.

Great hike.  I did a Google Earth Trail on Saturday here. You can do a virtual like walk of the trail and into the cave at www.shaunasadventures.com or on Google Earth.  We had on spikes/ Crampons and made it to the cave fine.  Headed up a little before 9, and there was not too many crowds, but as we headed down there was a huge group heading up.  Most people heading up had sleds.  I wish I would have asked them where they were heading to sled.  I am thinking they were going to take the V shaped trail marked on my blog to the North Fork road and then sled down it.  Definitely would have been fun sled ride down.
easy hike, good views. Dont try and get a picture by the falls unless you want to walk back with freezing feet. Ha!
Beautiful, easy hike. Cool ice cave. Hiked today (mid-January) with hiking/snow boots and we were just fine.
great hike! we didn't go up the last portion but it was so much fun anyway. snow was packed in but we had spikes and poles. definately need to go back and go up to the cave!

I hiked this yesterday with a friend. It wasn’t too crowded and the snow was packed down so hiking boots were fine. We didn’t do the very last part to the actual falls because it was too steep and slippery. Other people were doing it though.
Amazing short little hike. It has hard snow pack so no snow shoes necessary. The view at the falls is amazing. Truly a great one for the whole family. And the reward is well worth the work.

Lovely winter hike. The road and trail were sufficiently packed that snowshoes were not necessary, although they may help some folks. No waterfall visible during the winter, but it was still worth it for a beautiful woodland walk.

If you’re looking for an easy paved and cut out trail this is for you. You’ll be directed to the waterfall with ease. Now, if you want to go to see the donut shaped rock where the waterfall has cut through, you’ll need to do some climbing. My group scaled the waterfall. Shoes and pants were wet, but to us, it was worth it to feel the icy water and take pictures at the top. We typically do difficult hikes, so adding this climbing factor make it more interesting and worthwhile.
Good trail, the hike up to the trailhead was the biggest workout for me but the scenery was nice and it wasn’t too long
The trail is good now. No snow shoes needed.

This trail was SO beautiful today! The snow was perfect on the trees and mountains and good to walk through. Lots of people snow shoeing and with touring skis. I had hike spikes and poles and that worked great. The falls at the end was amazing and so worth traversing up the rocks at the top to get inside the little cave. The road to the trailhead is closed due to snow but it doesn’t make it that much longer.
I brought our family from Virginia, an 18,16,and 13 year old and my own kids 11,9,7,and 5 year old. Good snow, icy at the top. Beautiful at the top, good for all ages.

A nice gentle slope and walk through the woods until the last 150m.

You have to walk across the stream, skipping over stones and logs. The last 35m is a scrambling rock climb, pretty treacherous, so unless you have good climbing skills and suitable footwear, don’t even try it. If it’s been freezing it’s a no-go as the rocks are quite smooth and impossible to scale. Nice cave with waterfall at the top following the climb.
Nice walk but couldn’t get inside cave to see the photos posted.

Hiking on a weekday when it’s less busy? Want to shave 1.6 miles off the stated 3.0 mileage? Save yourself the aggravation and drive the 0.8 miles down the road to the ACTUAL trailhead. I really wish people used these reviews to provide useful information as was intended for this forum. The app incorrectly states that the trailhead is off the side of the highway but if you drive down the paved road for 0.8 miles you will see the actual trailhead. I was really irritated to add mileage walking down a private road which doubled the actual mileage of the hike — especially on a Monday when it wasn’t busy and there were spots at the trailhead. The trailhead isnt large so I imagine on weekends it would fill up quickly. I’d say maybe 20 cars can fit, maybe less. Wish I knew this before hand. Also once you make it to the waterfall if you want to see the actual donut hole that people photograph you have to hike up the waterfall over slick rocks. While this did not pose a problem for me, a lot of the reviews claim the elderly can do this hike and I’d like to clarify that it is true to a point given the climb up the waterfall itself. If you’re reading this please pass it forward and write useful information on these reviews so it helps everyone seeking information. Should be common sense. Don’t be a sheeple.

A good short hike that ends with a beautiful view in multiple directions. Be prepared to walk a ways up a snowy road to the trailhead if you go during the winter time.
Great trail. Some icy spots. Beautiful waterfall in a cave at the end.
Easy hike with just snow boots. If you want to go all the way up to the waterfall, spikes would be a good idea. Went on a Sunday afternoon and it was not crowded at all. Very pretty and scenic.
Did this twice. Extremely busy. Too many people.

I lots a silver eternity ring at the trailhead today taking pictures. If anyone happens to find it I would love to have it back. I’ve weary it everyday for over 10 years. Thanks. orangemusicnote@gmail.com.
Gorgeous hike during gentle falling snow.
Easy hike, even in the snow.
Great hike in December. Lots of snow and ice so crampons were very helpful. Falls are really cool. This trail only lost one star because of the high traffic. I recommend going at an off-peak time.

This is a short trail/ about .8 miles to the trailhead from the parking lot during winter- and another 1.5 to the falls. Very easy. There is a part that with snow and ice can be tricky, but even with that I would say anyone 3+ should be able to complete the trail with ease. A lot of beautiful trees, cool river, and I nice waterfall ending. A little shirt for
My personal liking but a nice trail nonetheless
Good for amazing photography.
Good for families with small children..also there's another cool trail called lake blancha trail right at the end of it
Looked nice but didn't actually hike it.  Walked from highway to trailhead on closed road, saw some moose, turned around.  Trail completely covered with slippery snow too slick for our boots.
Easy hike. A quick trot to some nice falls. Expect to park out from the trailhead, which added time to our hike.
Hiked this on 11/15. No snow on the trail.
No snow on the trail in early November and a well worth it hike. Definitely go all the way up to the falls.
Well worth it, very nice with the family but heavy traffic.
Highly trafficked

Great hike for a family or if you want to take it easy. Awesome little waterfall at the end. Would suggest wearing or bringing water sandals if you’re doing this in good weather.. you’ll cross some streams and it’s more fun not to worry about getting your shoes wet!
Was more impressed by the 7 Mule Deer, Pot Bellies(chipmunk type rodents), unique birds, and the pretty snowy trail than I was the not so waterfall. More like flowing stream is all.

This was a lovely, easy trail. When my husband and I went yesterday, the road to the parking lot was closed. We parked at the parking lot right off the main road and walked up to the trailhead and kept going. It's a nice hike to add onto another hike (like we did earlier in the morning) or even for a short by-itself hike. We finished it right before the snow hit so it wasn't as slippery. Be mighty careful, though, hiking down or up the actual waterfall itself. While we didn't do either, we watched people slip coming down. I would caution against doing so, without the proper trail shoe that has some grip. Also, be hesitant with your kids. Unfortunately, right when we arrived at the falls, we saw a family hiking down the actual falls and the daughter fell off a rock and hurt herself. Be careful!
Super slick and icy during this time of year. I fell like 4 times and was not wearing the proper shoes. Bring a hiking pole! Super pretty though!

It is an extremely crowded trail. A few jackasses even brought their dogs, which is illegal in this canyon. Really easy hike with a beautiful waterfall at the top. Good for kids and elderly people, bad if you don't like heavily trafficked trails.
Easy trail, good for kids. Plan on getting your feet wet. Very popular trail, the day we did it there were so many people there.
Weather is cold , water is cold . Easy hike but  climbing the rocks is a challenge
More like "do not falls", amirite?
Nice hike cool waterfall...crazy busy when went in July but I would do it again.
Enjoyable hike! Not too hard,  not to easy!
Nice easy trail but it was very crowded.
Easy hike, great in fall!

The lack of signs got me turned around but I eventually found a small parking lot past some private property. It’s shorter than I mentally was prepared for so that was good. You will have to scale the waterfall in order to get to the little cave - just be careful because currently it’s getting iced over. Easy to the base of the falls but after that is some bouldering.
Super easy hike. Great to walk and talk with friends. It was extremely crowded. Also, make sure to wear appropriate shoes if wanting to climb up to the waterfall. It's super slippery and rocky.
This is our homeschool field trip today!!! We used to go to Donut Falls with my parents and grandparents.
Very easy. Rocks are slippery when climbing up the waterfall. Worth the climb. Don’t go on a weekend! Way too many people.
Easy hike, went a little beyond to the inside and top of the cave. Be careful if you decide to climb on the rocks - very slippery! Beautifully unique waterfall
The best part of this trail was turning a corner, and staring face to face with two male moose. Very beautiful hike!
This is a very simple hike. It's pretty, but short and easy. The end you come upon the falls and it says to not climb the rocks, but we did it anyways and most everyone does. It's worth it too.
Easy and beautiful. Crowded as to be expected. Be careful climbing up the rocks to the falls. They become very slick.
This hike is for everyone! Bring water shoes or be willing to get yours wet... it'll be worth it.
It was a pretty great little hike, but it was crowded.
5 stars if you go early but this trail and falls can get packed with people quick.
nice hike, but very crowded and its popularity attracts people who don't necessarily respect nature. great time with kids, otherwise would take a pass.

Go up the waterfall at the end of the trail. Well worth it and way more fun, also where the waterfall is. You can exit at various sections of the canyon if you run into trouble.  Bring shoes to get wet.

Short hike that's family friendly. lots of trees and greenery. the end of the trail is up a rocky hillside through a stream. so if you want to see the cave and the waterfall it's best to bring shoes and clothes to get wet.
Fun, easy, pretty hike. We saw 3 moose when we were almost back to our car (near the trail head).

great short hike to a beautiful waterfall. Deffinatley worth climbing up the waterfall a bit so you can see the donut at the top. The water falls through a donut shaped hole in the rock and into a cave. You can wade into the cave and stand right next to the water.

Go early, less people on the trail during the week. Climb up into the waterfall could be challenging for some, but we someone carrying a baby in a backpack up to the actual hole/falls with little issue. Be prepared to get wet, wear hiking sandals or shoes you don't care about.

Not a fan. After years and years of hearing everyone rave about this hike, I finally did it myself and I was not impressed. First complaint is it was SWARMING with people! If you are looking for alone time in nature, this is not the hike for you. Also, It's not much of a "hike". Took me 20 minutes to get to the base of the waterfall. You get a perfect view of it, not sure why the need to scale slippery rock to get to the top and see the entrance of the waterfall. No thank you. My hiking boots kept slipping, and I wasn't about to plummet to my death. I turned around and went home with nature blue balls.
I love this trail with my wife...
Lovely short hike. Does require maneuvering up/down slippery rocks at times. Saw two bull Moose a turn into the trail! Waterfall is quaint but peaceful.
Beautiful
For those who aren't in great physical condition, the trail is doable but NOT "Easy"!  It's not paved and has several hills along the way.
Beautiful hike. I loved climbing up the river to reach the waterfall. I liked that it was more than just a dirt trail.

Donut Falls is short, albeit rewarding, hike in Big Cottonwood Canyon. All you have to do is follow the signs that say "trail" as there are offshoots you can follow but won't get you to the falls. We went twice during Pioneer Day weekend and by the time we were done, the trail was starting to get busy so if you go on a weekend, go early.

This is one of my all time favorite hikes. The scenery along the way is absolutely beautiful. We came across a huge moose and it was the highlight of the hike for me and my kids. The directions will take you right to the trailhead. This is a super popular hike though, so during the Fall go in the morning of during the day during the week. If you want to see the waterfall from the top I would suggest water shoes otherwise you'll almost certainly get your feet wet.
Short hike for amazing scenery. Cool doughnut formation waterfall.

A short, well traveled nice hike with waterfall area (would be difficult for some people to get down to - those with very young children or possibly older folks). Parking is difficult if you get there past mid morning.
Gorgeous hike and super easy

Easy trail up until the waterfall. If you're with children you may need two adults to get them down a steep rocky area down to the base of the falls. Then, you need to walk over rocks to get to the waterfall area. I had on water hiking shoes so it wasn't a problem but some of the kids I saw that didn't want to get their feet wet struggled. Overall it was beautiful, well worth it. We did it with a baby and toddler. You can't really picnic or anything by the falls. Kids/toddlers can walk it.
Great trail! Nice falls. You can't get a good view of the falls unless you climb. If you want photos without people in them GO EARLY. Otherwise there's people Everywhere!
Beautiful and quick and easy!  Only a few minutes and gorgeous scenery!

Lots of people on the trail which made it less enjoyable. I would not categorize this as easy! I had a blast as did my 12 and 14 year olds, but many families had smaller kiddos shrieking with fear, falling into the water, or being browbeaten and shamed into climbing up big slippery rocks.

Kind of boring.  When we went, Cotopaxi was doing some scavenger hunt thing where you "eat a donut at Donut Falls."  Meaning there were tons of annoying people who were throwing donuts in the bushes and pushing past you.

My husband was wearing our baby so we couldn't hike up to the actual "falls" part, just to the bottom of it.  You can't see anything from the bottom so unless you are willing to hike to the actual "falls" it is kind of boring.

In & out in less than an hour; again, that is without hiking all the way to the waterfall.  I'm sure young kids love this hike, we saw a lot of them.  Great for families.

Awesome waterfall with an easy hike. You can climb up the falls into the "cave", but be careful. We saw a lot a kids not being supervised even though it is inherently dangerous. We went up the falls. Very cold inside, but worth getting soaked.
Easy trail, extremely used.  I've done this 3 times in the last 5 months and winter with snow is hands down the best time to do it,  less people and a rope to climb up to the falls.

We did this hike the first week of June, and the water was too high to feel safe hiking to the Falls.  So we hiked up to see the water fall through the donut from above.  The kids felt that was totally pointless!
Today we hiked it again, and this time we made it not just to the Falls, but up to the Donut.  My two kids with special needs that affect their gross motor skills stayed at the base of the Falls.  They probably could have made it up to the Donut, but there is no way they could have climbed back down.  My 7 year old and I loved climbing in where the water falls through.  I'm so glad we went back!  Everyone LOVED the hike this time.

It's a short hike with a few rough spots. Definitely get there early. We got there around 7:30 am on a Saturday. There were people already coming back down and some about to go up. When we came back there were people driving around looking for a parking spot. Watch out for bikers. They are everywhere and some will not let you pass them.
we took our cat and he turned into an adventurer! love the scenery on this route. It's super simple!
Always a fun trail. Great for kids as well.
Great short 3.2 mile round.
A wonderful easy hike. A little bit crowded - but still nice & relaxing
This was a fun with the kids.
What a good hike! Getting to the bottom of he waterfall is very easy but it's an adventure to get to the top. Not easy but worth it

Beautiful trail. The wildflowers were a nice bonus. A little scramble down some rocks and then some walking through\across the river to get to the base of the falls. Get there early to get close parking.

Very easy hike to get to the falls. You can also hike up to an overlook that's above the falls, very steep but quick and it's an amazing view. To get to the actual donut you have to traverse some rocks up a steep incline but it's much easier than it looks.
I love this trail it's not difficult at all which is good for my bad back.
easy trail. anyone who marks this less than a 4 star is an idiot

Ya this is not a kids friendly hike. The 15 feet down the rocks was do able but then you had to hike through the creek which was maybe 4" deep. The part we stopped at was climbing round 75 feet up rocks to get to the doughnut.

The first 95% of the hike was easy, but the last 5% which is the whole reason why we did the hike was not easy.

This was a good simple hike up to the bottom of the falls. The rock climbing up the falls to get to the donut was easy enough for my seven year old. My older two kids really enjoyed climbing it too. We were lucky enough to be able to play around in the cave and run through the falls. The water is ice cold and there are lots of friendly hikers along the way. Parking is few on the trail, like only 12 spots, so we parked in the lot and walked up to the trail.
This hike was more of a walk not a hike which was not our cup of tea. Also highly trafficked!

Good for families. Small children okay until you reach the bottom of the falls. Very steep to reach falls. Requires more of a bouldering skill than hiking. Recommend good waterproof hiking boots/shoes for this section.
Great views, easy ascent, good with kids or as solo hiker. Ends at a cool/unique waterfall.  Path well marked and a good variety of sceneries (mountain views, along a creek, through a forest).

Had a blast with my kids on this one. Short, yet beautiful. Popular trail, so start early in the morning to avoid crowds. Gate to trailhead opens at 7:00 am, but we parked and walked in. We'll do it again for sure!
Classic hike for visitors!  But easy???  I wouldn't call it that. There is some rock manipulation to tackle....
Great hike for a hot day!
Good hike expect to get your feet wet.

This was an awesome trail. This app made it so easy to find for me.  There are so many interesting trails around Utah but don't know where to find them


This hike was fun, and matched the description
Very crowded on a Saturday afternoon. Hike up to the waterfall was not so child friendly.

Such a quick and easy hike to a beautiful waterfall. Its a great hike if you only have an hour before dark like my bf and I did. Love it . Lots of people, so if you are looking for seclusion DO NOT go here! Happy hiking people :)
Was a great hike but can be hard for smaller children to get up to the donut because you have to climb up some steep rocks. Other than that it was awesome.
A lot of fun!  Easy hike to beautiful water fall.  Plan to get your feet wet if you want to hike to the falls.  Slippery , but well worth it.
Busy but beautiful- plan to get your feet wet.

The trail is heavily trafficked but well maintained. I have an issue with the easy rating though. The hike itself is easy but then you get to a 20 foot rocky drop off you have to climb down to finish the hike to the falls.

We also started from the Spruces campground that adds an additional 3/4 to 1 mile each direction. We did see a few really pretty birds and tons of pot guts and chipmunks. We will do this hike again but will be better prepared next time.
Crowded, but the weather was fantastic

Great trail for an easy out and back for all ages. Stay to the left at the fork and it leads you right to the waterfall. Once you're at the waterfall you can either enjoy the sites or try to cross and get closer. Seems like a lot of people do the latter so something cool to check out. Only downside is that it can get pretty crowded on the weekends so just keep that in mind. 

Also, watch out for moose on your way in and out in the meadow next to the main road. The last two times I was up in the area there were two separate moose. Very cool!

Easy hike with a truly beautiful waterfall at the end! Usage is high so if you can go during the week or in the off-season you may be able to avoid some of the hiking traffic. If you want to get close to the waterfall bring shoes that can get wet, as you have to cross the stream to reach the base of Donut Falls.
It was great
This is a great family hike. If you have more than one car, be sure to park as many as possible at the UTA park and ride at the mouth of Big Cottonwood Canyon. Parking by the trail is limited.

Great hike! It was pretty easy, but our feet definitely got wet. We climbed up to the falls and on top - the water was really strong so didn't actually go inside.

Giving 4 stars because of the people. The amount there didn't bother us even though it was fairly crowded, but the trash did. Please pick up after yourself if you go!
This hike was great! We took our two young kids with us and they loved it

There is a reason this is the most popular hike in the Salt Lake valley. Gorgeous views, great for all ages and skill levels. If you plan on doing this hike on the weekend, go early (we hit the trail at 8 am and just missed a line of people trying to get to the falls).
Beautiful hike.. lovely falls.. plan on wet feet!
A nice short, easy hike to do if you're not looking for a challenge while hiking.
Great hike offer little challenges for children, lots of shade areas to rest on the way.
Terrible.  no signs and directions put you on the opposite side of road rather than parking lot and narrow trails
Heavily populated, a bit of a scramble up the falls. Excellent views at any level!

Compared to others falls in Utah that we have hiked to this one is a huge disappointment. It's an over populated easy hike. I was so excited to finally go see it and was hugely disappointed once we got to it. It's nothing compared to some of the falls in Utah that we have hiked to. Easy for kids or anyone to do. It's more of a tourist attraction than anything. I can at least now say that I have seen it but won't be going back to it.

Very easy hike until you get to the base of the falls. Getting up to the "Donut" is steep, but definitely do-able, just be cautious. There was too much water for us to get into the cave, but it was a gorgeous view at the top! The water is freezing. We brought water shoes to hike through the stream and up to the donut, which ended up being super convenient.

This was such a beautiful hike! We took tons of pictures, and it wasn't super long either. Wear shoes you're okay with getting wet, if you think you'll wanna get into the water. Super fun and pretty hike.
Nice easy trail. Technically you're not suppose to enter the water since it's a watershed.
the trail is not too difficult until right near the falls. kids handled it with no problem. definitely lots of hikers though, not a place to go if your looking for seclusion.
Nice trail. Good and easy. But it is very crowded.

This is a very easy hike to the falls and then it is a bit of a climb to get to the cave and "donut hole".  It is a great pay off at the top! The pool in the cave was quite cold, but a great way to cool off.  There are lots of wildflower and chipmunks along the trail.
Definitely not a strenuous hike at all but the last part of getting to the waterfall it's pretty steep. Lots of people in the summer!
Fun hike. Water is COLD but feels kinda nice on a hot day. The trail is easy enough until you get to the water. Gets a little trickier but still fairly easy. Had a great time and will go back!

As mentioned, this is a heavily trafficked trail. When we did this trail on 26 June 2017 there was probably over a 100 people we saw on the trail including a large group of kids from a nearby camp. Not a trail for solitude. 

The "trail" gets pretty hairy if you actually want to see the falls at the top. The water is very cold but the view is worth it.
Very beautiful and fun to do with the whole family. The water was freezing but after the hike to the falls, it felt great!
Crowded and overrated.  Plenty of other hikes with waterfalls with less people.

Easy hike from the trailhead, but park near the highway for more of a walk.  We took a toddler and it was a good activity for him.  He loved the water when we got there.  There is no way to actually get to the waterfall without walking through some water, at least that I found.
If your hiking from the main road its 3 miles round trip.
Fun hike especially if you go above the falls. Lots and lots of people though.

Lots of people but not a problem. Trail splits off to go above the waterfall, too. Easy and short enough to go back and do both parts of the trail. Lots of water rushing now, so you can't climb close to the falls or under the donut as pictured in several photos people have posted. So don't expect that? Definitely interesting to go to the upper trail and see the "donut" hole that the waterfall goes through since you can't tell from lower part. Upper trail is mostly shaded.
a blast. definitely go on a weekday, not a weekend
I love it
Great for kids! You must walk up the river and picnic at the base of the falls. But it's ice cold!!!

We love this hike to kick off the summer. Fair amount of shade and easy for the youngest hikers. We did not climb to the donut as the water is very high/fast yet (June 15) for two young children. We went earlier in the day so it wasn't as busy. Parents, please don't let your children feed the wildlife though.
Amazing views and great for beginners
Great trail for all ages. Impossible to get to the donut without getting wet, so either wait a few weeks or be ready to hike down with wet shoes.
nice hike for the kids, so much water now that you can't get too close to the falls.
Crowded, easy, fun.

Hiked with my 7 year old. It was fun but short. The river is raging right now, so you can't get very close to the falls, as it has overflowed some of the path. We hiked up to check out the view from above the falls and it was pretty, but not a very clear path. Still had a fun time and would recommend this short hike.
Beautiful but it is usually packed in the summer
Good, easy hike with some nice scenery. The falls were cool, but it was tough to get a good view of them with how much water is flowing.
Beautiful area, easy trail. Water is still high so we didn't go up to the donut as we had some small children in our party. Still pretty from the base though.
First Hike ever ...plus first hike in Utah.  Very easy, but the water is Cold
Easy, good for me and my kids.  It was beautiful and nice & cool on a hot day.
Excellent family hike. Well shaded trails options. Stay creek side right to get to upper view of waterfall. High creek flow will prevent walking to the base of waterfall.
Great hike. Fairly easy. Water is running high and fast.
Easy going with an amazing view when the water is full.

Don't stop at the first falls. There's a trail that goes up and behind the lower falls, and follows the river until you get to the top. The donut is a large stone hole the river falls through. Very dramatic and well worth the extra hour of hiking.
Very unique falls, quick hike from the trailhead.
Lovers it super easy kid friendly
Fun, easy, short trail. Lots of great sights and other hikers. Seems not many (I didn't see anyone else) knows the other trail to scramble right down to the falls.

Much easier hike than I thought it'd be.  There are many different ways to go when your get to the falls, we went up the back to look down on it.  Would have loved to go through the river up to the falls but the water was a little fast so I opted not to.  Hoping to return later this summer when it's not so high and explore more!
Nice family hike.  A few areas of snow on the trail but mostly dry.  Make sure that you bring an extra set of shoes if you plan to go up the falls.

Still a bit frozen near the top, including part of the donut. The last 5 yards are in the river itself with minimal opportunity to avoid getting your feet wet. This is one of the more crowded trails I've seen in the area, so be warned (though that could have just been holiday weekend traffic).

Nice walk in the woods for families. To get all the way to the falls, plan on getting a little wet. (Keep a close eye on little kids while crossing the river until the snow pack thaws and the river isn't running as quickly).

Great hike for families with kids slightly on the older side. 6 and up maybe, unless of course you plan on carrying your little ones. Water shoes highly recommend because the last 50 yards is literally in the creek. You'll also want to boulder up the cascades and enter the actual donut shaped cave where the water fall has carved a hole in the rock. Really cool. Obviously use caution during high water season.
Awesome trail for the family
Easy 30 minute walk to the river, then some snow and mud.   Need to walk through the ice cold water to get to see the falls up close.
crowded trail with some snow at the top (May)
Although there were lots of people and the trail was slippery muddy from some of the snowpack melt off, this trail was super fun! We were able to take my 7 year old brother along with us.
Get to the trailhead by 8 and you can beat the crowds! A little muddy but the falls are pretty with some snow still on the them.
Absolutely wonderful!! Easy hike, some mud and slush but nothing too bad. Once you reach the water, it's a slippery climb to the top. Be prepared to get your feet wet! So worth it!

Super fun and exciting hike if you plan on hiking up the waterfall. It was well worth it as long as you be careful hike climbing up. Bring an extra set of clothes if you don't want to freeze. Make sure you are looking  at the map though, I accidentally hiked the wrong route and hiked an extra 2 miles up from the waterfall.

From the recent snow melt, the river and falls were flowing rapidly (according to locals). Still some snow patches along trail, but not impassable.  Sat at the base of Falls and soaked in the sounds and sights.  Be careful if attempting to climb up to Falls, snow is getting undermined from water.  You'll get wet, but enjoy the experience!! Also, as of 5-15-2017 the paved road up to trailhead was still closed.
Avoid going on a Saturday on a beautiful summer day. There was soooo many people that we had to stop and wait 5 minutes at a time here and there because there was a bottle neck of people. Yeesh.
may 12. road closed .can't get to it due to snow
There was still a decent amount of snow on the trail today, but definitely worth it. Got some gorgeous pics with the snow in the background.
Didn't quite make it to the falls because there was still quite a bit of snow but always a beautiful hike!

Super easy hike with a good payoff at the end. I went 5/12/17 and there was a decent amount of snow, but it was paved down. The flow of water right near the falls was fairly high, so don't expect to make it without walking in the steam a portion of the way. Also, within the falls the water was hitting around knee height. A easy, must-do hike here in the valley
lots of snow but over all was a great hike :)

This is a very easy trail, and nice if you're looking for a short one! The donut is beautiful, and has a little bit of climbing you can do once you get to the end. They're very serious about having no dogs on this trail, basically in the entire canyon. So be cautious!
This was a fun hike,  lots of snow and so fun using the rope to make it to the falls.
nice little hike for exercise, hiked it in May and there was snow from the second parking lot to the falls. looking forward to going back in summer

Trail was still completely snow packed, but path was easy to see and follow, just be prepared to slip and slide a bit and get wet because of it. Made the trail harder than I expected, but boy that payoff was amazing! Be sure to head up and into the cave of the falls, otherwise you miss that payoff

Still lots of snow, poles are a great idea, hike over the top of the falls back to service road slippery and treacherous, through snow up to the knees! Not recommended until snow is gone! Gorgeous hike, moderate difficulty in the snow.

This trail is gorgeous and super easy! You can't bring dogs anywhere up big cottonwood though so be forewarned before you make the mistake of trying!

It's nice for summer because it is pretty cool with the water and most of the shade. A nice hike you could do anytime of the day.
Tip: keep left.

Short and easy hike but very pretty! Some fresh snow today so bring your hiking boots or snowshoes. You have to cross a small stream but nothing major. You do have the option to hike to the top at the end although advised against my crew
Couldn't resist. It was worth the view and you can climb inside a cave surrounding the waterfall.
even with a few feet of snow this trail was enjoyable

before you go... don't follow the gps. based on the footprints most people do and we ended up passing it by a couple miles. fun hike still But when you see the bathrooms half way up, stay left.  it's a flatter more direct path to the falls.  super slick right now as the snow is melting wish I would have worn picks. beautiful hike though!

Followed the trail according to the apps GPS and never found the Falls. Two other groups of hikers ran into the same issue. Snow made it difficult to follow trail signs exactly, but ended up being fun regardless.

Went a little too early in the season, lots of snow and wasn't able to make it to the actual falls due to the snow but it was a fun and adventurous hike none the less. People were climbing the canyon wall to the falls and using the snow packed canyon wall to slide the entire way back down. We decided to head back in the summer when it wasn't so snow packed!
A destination hike, so you should surely get in and behind the cave of the falls. Snow is melting everywhere and it can be slippery at places. Wear good boots to enjoy this trail before April.

I took off before the crowds and at a great time to see moose in the area of the houses on the right as you start up. The last part up to and in my case into the cave where the falls enter is a rock or boulder scramble and it's easy to allow the excitement to propel you up the rocks at a faster pace than is safe so take your time and enjoy picking your route up. Once at the entrance you'll see it's a must to get inside and enjoy the falls up close. I brought along sandals for the water section and anyone wanting to fully enjoy it should also wear a pair of pants with either zip off Legs or plan on rollin the legs up, you won't want to miss going inside.
Great trail to go on anytime of the day. My brother and I went mid afternoon and even with the snow on the ground, it wasn't difficult to get to the top of the falls.
Very icy and slippery this time of year and chilly in the canyon, prepare for a snowy hike!
love it during winter.
Perfect winter night hike.
Still really snowy up there! Very slippery!

Me and my 12 year old daughter had fun on this hike yesterday. With the snow it made it the perfect workout- not too easy and not too hard. We hiked to the very top of the falls and used the rope they had there to slide down with our jackets!
Beautiful snowy morning. Nice view all along
Great for winter hiking. A bit intense near the top but it's worth it! Overall it's a pretty easy trail with some great views.
We used snowshoes and it was more intense than an "easy" rating!! If there is snow, prepare to walk on a slick trail and a very difficult ascent to the Donut cave!
Great winter hike but in the summer its over crowded with little kids running around screaming everywhere.

Donut Falls Trail was packed but well worth the crowd!  I happened to go up on a Sunday that also happened to be father's day. I was lucky to have found parking.  The trail was an easy one shared with a lot of families and you have the option once you reach the falls to stay at its base and enjoy the view or you can climb the rocks all the way up to the donut and even past the ledge where you will find a beautiful stream running over more rock and fallen trees.

Loved this hike. We used snowshoes, but most hikers were just in boots or had crampons. The falls are awesome in the winter. There is so much snow up there right now...had a great time tromping off in the deep snow.

I hiked this today in regular snow boots! The trail is so packed down now that I was okay not wearing snowshoes! Of course, the majority of people do use snowshoes though. It was beautiful and fairly well-marked for being so snowy. You do have to walk about a mile up the road from the parking lot to get to the actual trial because the gate to drive up is closed for winter. It was a great hike- not too hard, not too easy (because of the added difficulty added by snow). I will definitely come back to this hike during the spring.
Great Hike!  Trail is so packed you don't even really need snowshoes.
Really nice hike. The last bit climbing up next to the waterfall to the "donut" is a bit dangerous, but it's beautiful, once you get there.

Beautiful. One of my favorite hikes. Very easy. I like to go up in the summer because you can drive to the bottom of the trail vs. before or after when you have to walk there. Very fun. I enjoyed climbing to the falls.

Water level near the falls is pretty low, which makes crossing the creek and, for the ambitious thrill seekers, climbing to the top waterfall much easier. The trail is pretty muddy past the official trailhead, so be careful of slipping.

Upper trail head parking is closed for the season, so you'll be adding an extra bit of time and distance to your hike. Keep left at the forks, and be weary of slippery rocks.
Is the trail closed? November 13 today, but I see people tracked their hike this month. App says it's closed October

Great hike for my family including 3 year old. The app does not take you to the trailhead. It says to park on the left. You actually have to drive up a road to the right a bit to get to the parking lot/bathroom. We hiked about 1000 feet up the trail to the left. It actually goes to a lake but we turned around and drove across the street.
Easy trail and GREAT for kids. Bring extra socks

This trail is super easy until you get to the falls at the end. You have to climb up a rock wall to get to the cave at the top where the "donut" is. It's very slippery and cold, but if you manage to get all the way to the top it is really awesome. I wouldn't recommend this for small children. It would be to dangerous for them to climb the rocks.
Turn right onto Cardiff fork road to get to the trail head!

Took a two year old and four year old on this hike. Was a little long for the two year old. Very muddy and slick from snow patches. Beautiful colors though. Read a review that said the trail was on the opposite side of where the app takes you but that wasn't the case. We just got to cross the street twice. Trail head was on the south side by a large parking lot and restrooms.
Super fun
Nice easy hike with beautiful colors!

Great little trail, i ran it but would recommend it for anyone (including families with kids). One note, the trailhead is on the opposite side of the road than what the app says (it's on the south side).

Nice falls, but the trail was not very well marked.  With the assistance of fellow hikers I managed to find the falls.  Saw 5 deer and two moose during the hike.  Would like to go back and find the cave when I have more time.
We opted not to finish when we ran into a moose and his girlfriend. Beautiful creatures, beautiful hike. Will go back to reach the end!
Did this hike today.  It was a beautiful hike.  There is (limited) parking at the trail head up the road.

This was a great trail to hike. Be aware though, if you have small children with you, or if you don't climb too well, there is one spot where you have to climb down about a 10 foot rock wall. There is also a small stream to cross, though it's not deep at all. Once you reach the falls you can stay at the bottom and enjoy the scenery from there, or you can  climb up some moderately difficult rocks to get to the cave. Keep on climbing to get to the top. What a view!
Most overrated hike in the Wasatch.

My kids and I did this one on Sunday night just to stretch the weekend out a little longer. It's an easy walk, good for having silly conversations with the family. And of course we couldn't resist climbing the rocks at the end. It's great!

Nice hike. Not difficult at all. The falls was more of a trickle but still pretty nice. My 10 year old was able to do this hike no problem. Not overly crowded but a fair amount of people hiking. Recommend this hike for sure.
Donut Falls is more like a walk to me, great for kids but wish I could bring my dog. Hiked up over the falls and back into the mountain a ways, it was beautiful.
This trail hike was wonderfully exciting with views into the valley below. Lots of traffic on a Saturday and Sunday.

We really enjoyed this trail. It would be a 5 star worthy if there would have been less people. There was literally people everywhere. I have been on less busy city sidewalks. 

That being said it was a beautiful trail and the leaves were changing. It was really fun!
love! great, short, gorgeous hike. the water is very cold. awesome after work trail, easy to run

I completed this hike with my 2 yr old and 3 yr old. The entire hike was doable with young ones with the exception of climbing to the top of Donut falls. The scramble was a little too much for the babies. Still a fantastic hike
Nice for kids pretty view at the end

The hike was easy, but beware of slippery boulders near the end of the hike. Donut falls isn't much to look at from below where the trail takes you. I had my young children, so we didn't dare scale the rocks to the top, although I bet it's beautiful from up there. Overall it was just okay. Nice little hike, but not all that great unless you're willing to risk your life at the end!
The waterfall at the end is the coolest part. We climbed up, regardless of the signage telling us not to. Rebels.
Have snowshoed this trail and love it for that. Too crowded of a hike. All the ppl ruin the experience.
Simply amazing day.
The hike was great. Only issue I had with this is all the trash left along the trail and near the falls.. People need to pick up after themselves.
We came with several friends. It was a lot of fun. The only drawback was there were so many people! Way too many. Great hike anyways.
easy hike, lots of people

We saw moose and walking inside the donut hole and walking over a log to get closer was fun. Gf wouldn't let me get too close to see on top but would of been fun to look directly over. Short hike but was good prep for lake Blanche

The best time to go is around 9 am. It's nice and cool and it's not crowded. The trail was clean and it was beautiful. You do have to climb up some rock at the very end to see it well. But the trail to get up there is really easy. Your feet will most likely get wet so expect that.
The water is so clear and beautiful. I went in the falls and it was freezing cold. I loved the trail and playing in the water❤️
The waterfall is so fun to climb!

Short hike with a great payoff. The falls are gorgeous. The hike has a challenging incline for novice hikers but I saw plenty of grandmas and children completing the whole trail. Be careful of trail forks because the correct path is not always marked but there are usually enough people hiking that you can just follow the flow. You will have to cross the stream at the end and your shoes might get wet.
Great afternoon hike. Saw a young bull moose on the way back down. Not from an area with mountains so I thought it was a little more difficult than an easy but not too overpowering.

I loved this hike years ago, but the trail has washed out sometime since the last time I've done it. Now you have to cross the river and scramble up the rocks to get to the falls. It's still nice, but not as nice as it once was.

Easy hike up to the falls. Your feet will get wet. Be prepared! Moderate/hard rock scramble up the top of the falls is optional, but to get in the "donut" you'll have to do it! Lots of slick rock. Packed with families. Beautiful views at the top. Overall, I'd do it again.

if you're going to come here early don't come before 7am unless you don't mind walking in from the main road to the trailhead. the gates to the road up to the trailhead does not open til 7am. we came early and parked in the lot just off the main road and walked approximately half mile up the road, past the private homes to the trail head. Super easy hike and judging from the trash along the trail it's popular. majority of the trail is covered and great for kids.
Easy for kids I really loved it
Beautiful and worth the trail and the end with a refreshing splash!
Easy for young children. Lots of fun
Loved it!
First part of the hike was the paved road to the trailhead. Beware of cars if you hike from the bottom.

This was a great hike with mostly easy terrain.  We took the left fork and did encounter some boulders that we had to climb down in order to get to the creek.  Poles could come in handy crossing the creek at the end.  I didn't track the distance but it seemed shorter than 2 miles in.  Then again, the trail was so easy that it didn't require rest stops.
"Heavily Trafficked" is an understatement.  If you wait too long in the day, you will find yourself waiting in line to climb up/down boulders and obstacles.  Parking at the trail head is very limited.
Great short hike fit for the whole family. Climbing the rocks up to the cave are a bit tricky but well worth it.
Great hike for my 6 year old and me! He loved rock climbing at the end to see the donut! Not nearly as busy as I was expecting, but we went on a Tuesday afternoon.

We arrived around 9am in a Tuesday, easily found parking in the lot and headed up. Never being here before I wasn't sure what to expect! The trail to the falls was easy for my seven year old, but once we got to the falls we were unable to see the donut feature. In order to get to the cave we were told we had to climb up the wet rocks. We made it half way but my little got scared and we went back down. Very cool none the less and I want to return without kids!

Be prepared for wet feet! As we were leaving some girls were trying to walk on rocks worried about their shoes... Parking lot was full when we left as was the rode leading to the trailhead (around 11am). 

Best part: we saw a deer!

We went at 8:00 am and there was just a handful of people up and back. We even enjoyed the falls by ourselves. As we were leaving the parking lot people were starting to flood in. We know from experience that this hike is something you do early in the morning because of the amount of people (especially kids).
It was very pretty and easy...but far too crowded for us
One of my all time favorites!
Beautiful hike. Lots of squirrels, Aspen and people. Went on a Wednesday night and probably saw 100 other people.
Easy, quite crowded.  Worth the effort.  We hiked from Spruces campground.
Easy trail, just plan on wet feet. lots of people.
Easy trail but we took the wrong one and had to walk back down to the creek and walk about 5 minutes into it and climbed up donut falls it was so worth it
easy easy but wear wet shoes at the end
Love this hike a bit crowded but love to climb up into the cave. That makes it all worth it.

This was a really easy and quick hike - maybe a 30 minute hike to the falls. Once you get there you have to walk through a freezing cold creek for about 10 minutes to actually get to the "donut falls" section, but once you get to the falls/cave area it's absolutely fantastic. There's a hole at the top of a cave with water gushing through it, hence donut falls. You can actually go inside the cave, if you're man enough, and view everything up close. I highly recommend this hike to anyone! Great time. Oh and I know I mentioned this, but your feet will get wet.

We love this hike and try to go every year.  Avoid the weekend crowds - it gets nuts up there.  We like to bring a box of donuts to enjoy.  Water shoes would be a good idea to more easily cross the water at the top.

Great family hike with lots of shade. The falls are really pretty,  but the wet rocks can be slick. Our adventurous  teenage son climbed to the top and actually fell through the donut. Fortunately, he wasn't hurt, but he certainly could have been!
Nice early morning hike.
Very busy.  Parking lot off main road is 1/2 mile from the trail head.  If you have little kids it's worth driving to the trail head to see if you can find a closer spot.  Easy hike for all ages.
Great family hike
One of my favorite "beginner" trails, it started my love affair with hiking.

The perfect hike for a family with kids. Even on a hot summer day, the temperature is comfortable. Water, a snack and bug spray are recommended. There are plenty of places for some great photos.
