I'd recommend parking just off the road and walking in as opposed to trying to get a parking spot right at the trailhead.

Family loved it.  Easy hike until you get to the end.  A little bit challenging with toddler.  Be ready to get your feet wet, and bring extra shoes to change into after.  It's worth it going all the way to the top to see the water falls and the hole.  Watch out for slippery rocks.  Have fun :)
pretty easy hike. it can be crazy crowded on weekends and i have never been on it without seeing other people. the falls are beautiful, but there can be quite a bit of garbage in places.

Great short hike to a really interesting watetfall. I would recommend arriving early. This trail can get rather busy. We started at 0800 and it was perfect. Not real busy. On the way up to the waterfall we ended up seeing a moose. On the way back down the trail it started to get real busy and once we got back to the trailhead the parking lot was full and people were parking along the road.
It's a fun little hike, but insanely crowded, we didn't spend too much time at the falls since there were so many people. But way easy hike.
nice
Pretty easy trail that is great for kids/non-hikers. My only complaint about Donut Falls is that it is often really busy.
Great quick hike in the area when water fall is flowing

Pretty easy, some places it's difficult to figure out which trail you use, and it would've been nice if the park ranger would've told us about the easier side! All in all, really cool trail, lots of little wildlife running around and the falls are really cool!!

Perfect evening hike but expect to see lots of people due to its popularity. I suggest wearing sandals so that you can walk on rocks in the cold water. When you get to the falls, it's best you just admire the scenery at the bottom if you're inexperienced. If not, it's a fun scramble to a cool view of the falls! Perfect way to cool off, too.

nice hike. 4 kids did great. didn't make it all the way to the top as the rock climbing for my 8 and 9 year old so
was too steep. I recommend driving the mile farther to the trail head... especially for someone with small children. Having to park in the lot just makes it that much more walking for kids in the heat. water was cold and rocks were slippery, but it was beautiful.  Busy trail for sure.

Doughnut Falls is an easy hike with beautiful views throughout and several cascading waterfalls. This is a fun summer hike and is pretty in the fall too. During late June and July you can see lots of wildflowers along the trail. 

This is a very popular trail because it's easy enough for even young kids. I recommend arriving by 9am so you can get a parking spot in the small lot by the falls trailhead and avoid the crowds. If you hike it mid-morning or afternoon it will be a zoo. It is regularly so busy that people park along the main Big Cottonwood Canyon road and walk down the road to get to the trailhead. Better to just arrive early. 

To get closest to the falls, for the best views, you're probably going to get your feet wet. And prepare yourself, the water is cold! When we hike it in mid June, the water was at least a foot deep crossing the stream. Water shoes would have been very helpful. But we forgot to bring them so we just got our hiking boots wet.
Short but pretty. A little crowded.

The hike was great and pretty easy! It is only crowded where the river crossings are or the more challenging parts. Just because people are being cautious so they don't get hurt but other than that I would recommend this hike to all ages!
Nice short family hike, if you have little kids. Not a trail I would visit regularly. Gets a little crowded.
nice little stream to pick through at the end toward the falls.
Easy good for kids until the end were you have to climb the water fall to get to donut
Don't believe the title. There's no donuts on this trail. Beautiful hike. We climbed the water fall all the way up. Looked hard when you see it at first, but it's easier to climb than it looks.
great trail! great hike for the family esp young kids!

The overall trail was nice. I parked up in the parking at the end of the private property road. It took me awhile to find it. I'm a bit hefty so the steep incline about killed me. But I pushed through and it was a beautiful hike. But the trail ends before the falls so I didn't actually get to see the falls. My friend who is more athletic then me went but she slipped and fell once because of how slippery the rocks were. The first part of the hike is family friendly. The second part not so much. It was a shortish hike but I'm not going to be doing it again it didn't peak my interest that much to come back.
Easy nice hike. Cool down by the water. Lots of shade, birds, chipmunks.
Little strenuous for the first 10 mins uphill but everything after was perfect!
Great hike. Way too many forks win the trail without signs though. Took the wrong way twice and had back track.
Nice short hike.  It felt great to walk in the ice cold water!
Just great.  Lots of traffic today,  but still a good time.   Weather was wonderful too.  The falls are beautiful.
This hike is very crowded. Couldn't get to the falls, because there were too many people huddled at the top.
Super easy, kid friendly hike. Gets really crowded, so go early.
Nice hike

Very highly trafficked trail. Was hoping for a little more from how much I have heard about the hike. Rather short--very kid friendly hike. When we went, there was so much water!! Too much to get in or anything. Overall, this hike took about an hour and a half, but we started from the high parking lot, which the walk to the actual hike was longer and harder than the actual hike itself.
It was a great hike for my two little boys. They did it no problem. It was a beautiful hike! Enjoy

Very popular hike but that's understandable given how easy and accessible it is. You're technically not supposed to climb the waterfall but everyone does it anyway. If you choose do to this, just be careful because it's easy to slip and fall on the jagged rocks (learned that the hard way). Good hike for beginners, lovely waterfall!

Great hike, easy enough for kids and short and sweet.  Off the main canyon road you can drive to the trail head depending on how busy it is to get a parking spot.  The hike is shaded in many spots.  Once to the falls your feet will get wet because you need to cross the creek to get to the main attraction.
Love this hike it's a cute simple hike that I took my family on. My 7 year old and 11 month old, toddler friendly and loved the donut water fall.
Very beautiful hike. I really enjoyed this hike with my friends.
Donut falls is a fun little hike. Very family and kid friendly! There's a pretty waterfall at the end! bring water shoes if you plan on climbing up the waterfall!
easy kids friendly.

the trail is easy for kids. the waterfall is nice but you have to walk a bit in the water, the water is pretty cold and maybe not that easy for small kids.
the trees and flowers along the way are great , but it is way tooooo crowded that it is no longer fun.

Fairly easy hike. It is longer when you have to park along the highway. The actual falls can be seen from below, but to see why it is called Donut Falls requires scrambling up a more difficult rock area than most younger children can do safely.

We loved this! Unfortunately we couldn't find the trailhead so I think we added about 2 miles onto our trajectory. We finally found it after we were nice and sweaty already. You'll have to turn right off of the main road and head up a little ways until you can't drive any further, there will be a little parking lot there. The trees are huge and amazing. The falls were really gushing so it was too dangerous for my kids to go up too far, but it was gorgeous. Lots of people there for a Sunday night but really a great experience anyway.
Absolutely beautiful. Went in the morning and it wasn't too crowded.
Gorgeous. Waaaaay crowded. to the point where we had to wait in line twice to pass a narrow part of the trail.
Good trail to take kids on. The runoff was too swift so we had to stop at the part where you get down next to the water.
Killer!!
I wish there was a bigger payoff at the end.  brought our 4 year old son and he did great.  family friendly

Easy trail except towards the falls the trail drops off and you have to climb down rocks. Many people seem to miss it and end up on another trail. The water was high and I had little ones with me so we did not hike to the cave.
Great
we did this one Saturday.  easy hike. pay attention  to trail signs near the f or or you'll miss the left turn to the falls. water temp was around 42 and high so plan ahead. great hike for family

This is an easy trail and very doable with small kids (had 2, 5, 6, 7, and 9 yrs). Right now the water is still a little too high and fast for the kids to cross the river so we didn't get all the way to the falls. We'll go back later in the summer. It's beautiful though!
Love this hike! If you don't want the trail to be crowded it's best to go first thing in the morning.

one of my favorite hiking trail. not that difficult and good for the first timers. and the climbing up to see the donut falls is the craziest part of it and i just love it. make sure to wear waterproof shoes guys!
Short hike but fun.
Great hike, took the fork on the right instead of left where the falls are. Took the trail as from as I could. First hike in years, great hike for getting back into the outdoor game.
This is an interesting trail. Definitely easy, the first half is paved on a road. Unfortunately it was extremely crowded on memorial day and hard to enjoy because of that.
Very family friendly. was really crowded the Saturday we went. Rocks slick and still snow on the ground, but is awesome hike.
Great for beginners! Family Friendly

Great trail. The directions said that it was on the left but it's actually on the right. The gate was closed when we went on Memorial Day weekend, so it was a longer hike. We ended up climbing up above the falls which was fun but a little scary. Bring shoes to get wet in because your feet will get wet crossing the falls!
Really beautiful foresty hike with a great waterfall at the end.

If you live in salt lake, you can do the whole trip and trail in under 2 hours, so this is a great get outta the city hike, or worth doing if you are in the area. 

Still was snow on the ground in late may, but the water falling through the snow made it even more majestic. 

Five stars because it's everything  you need in a short hike.

It was a fun hike - there was still snow on the ground and lots of mud (5/25/16), so be prepared for that. Only one or two points where we had to actually climb up and over rocks up to the bottom of the falls. If you want to go on to the top you have to cross the river and then it's quite a steep climb for a little way.
Easy hike, lots of fun, waterfall is pretty neat.
It was amazing, bring shoes that will get wet and destroyed, it will be a small price to pay those shoes! Great for family fun and awesome views!
Great hike! All uphill to the falls but that just makes the hike back easier. Lots of friendly people.
love the hike. This place is ALWAYS crowded.  Go during the week and in the morning for the best parking and less people . Even then,  it gets crowed fast.
Fun and very easy hike but pretty icey right now by the actual falls so it's a bit of a bummer trying to climb up

Great short hike.  If you want to get up to the main cave you'll have to do some climbing.  When there is still snow on the ground it's nearly impossible to get up without ice traction for your shoes, so make sure to bring a pair!

It's slippery. People are sliding along the trail causing it to lose traction. Still a nice hike. Not hard. The beginning is steep, even tho it's paved, it elevates quickly. Great pictures.

The rope broke at the end to climb up to the donut, but you can still get up. Be careful coming down, you might as well just slide down.
A bit slippery on the packed snow, but the falls are incredible!
it's still snow covered which means it's not crowded yet. stay on the packed parts of the trail or you'll risk sinking. the falls are gorgeous. hope to visit again.

One of my favorite hikes, have done two times in the summer and once in March. The time I did it in March the gate blocked us off so it added a few miles but the hike was not awful. Great hike, especially fun because you can hike over and around the falls.
It was great. Went on a cold day so it was not too crowded .

What a gorgeous trail!! It's was paved for the first half mile and no snow.  The rest of the trail was snow packed. We were fine in hiking boots and tennis shoes but very slippery in places. Our hiking poles were great to have with the snow and staying balanced.  The trail and water fall was pretty!! Going back in the fall to hike again☀️
Went up today (early April).  It was a little slippery on the well packed snow,  but other than that,  well worth it.
Did this in December without snowshoes and was just fine. Very quick. Nice falls at the end in the winter, with parts still frozen!

I hiked this the second weekend of March, so there was still a lot of snow on the ground. Because of this, to get to the waterfall, we had to slide down some snow and into a cave. It was absolutely breath taking! There was snow covering the donut, so where the water was coming through was leaving ice crystals around it. The hike itself was difficult due to the snow, we were slipping all over the place. But if we had on better shoes it wouldn't have been so bad! The land around it is beautiful and I'll definitely be going again!
My go-to hike! I love it!
Great hike all year round!
there was a lot of snow but great with the kids. we went in hiking clothes and a light sweater we started getting hot going up.
Early March it is still snow-covered and beautiful! Definitely plan to go back when the snow melts.
easy fun hike really enjoyed the falls and cave
This was an amazing hike. Did it in the winter, so we were the only ones there. Perfect day hike for the whole family.
It's super easy walk the snow makes even better
Short fun hike, easy to miss trailhead in winter

Went with a group of 10, nice wider trail perfect for us all. We all had snowshoes but only about half wore them. They provide some extra traction, but sometimes just got in the way. Trail was quite easy, some scrambling was required if you hiked up to the falls. Nice sunny day, would be fun to take sleds, too.

Such a fun and easy hike. I went snowshoeing with a friend, we were able to make it all the way. The tail is pretty patted down so it was easy to find. You probably don't even need snowshoes, except they were helpful to get to the top to when the little cave is.
Easy beautiful trail
Easy, beautiful trail.  Nice waterfall at the turnaround point.  Were blessed with snow that day, which made the hike even more gorgeous.

Short easy hike with fun waterfall at end
Great hike for kids and beginners.
Nice and relaxing trail. There is an atv trail nearby that can add some unwanted noise to your hike.
Nice even short trail. Very nice falls. Climb up to the grotto!!
Nice short hike. Beautiful views. Usually busy. Easy hike for snowshoeing in the winter!

Several friends recommended Donut Falls to us. We have a 3- and 1-yr-old and they both walked most of this trail. We thoroughly enjoyed the beautiful and changing views all along the trail. It was fun to cross the water over the stepping stones.
Just did this today in about 1.5 hours (with kids). The trail was active but never too crowded. We didn't go up to see the "donut" because I fell in the waterfall. But the trail was lovely!

It was beautiful. Traffic wasn't high at noon on a Friday. Safe enough for older kids with helmets, lots of razor sharp rocks toward the top. Wear comfortable boots with excellent grip if you intend to see the pot of gold (cave) at the end of the trail!
Loved coming here in the summer. Easy but really fun and the water makes it a refreshing summer hike.
A nice quick nature getaway. It is a heavily trafficked trail, but great for families. The water flow is pretty low and you do have to climb up the rocks to see the "donut".
Well marked trail. Super short and easy. Very mild elevation. Waterfall disappointing but nice walk through the trees.

You should get there early if you want to have some quiet while hiking (and get a parking spot at the trailhead), because the heavy usage specified is VERY heavy. It's more of a walk than a hike, but be prepared to climb a waterfall at the end, despite the sign that says not to!
Super easy and so awesome! ✌
Great family hike. We absolutely loved this trail and the falls.
Not much of a hike and no view...fun climbing the rocks though!
Really easy hike.  Pretty falls.
Pretty place but very easy and short. Too many people.
The falls are a bit overrated/ underwhelming but it's a nice trail quick and easy.
Short. Great for kids. Hard to find parking.
Really  to get to fall you have to climb a water fall so you will get wet so bring water shoes with you.

I loved this trail! We've been wanting to do it for a while now but it's ALWAYS busy on weekends. We had to go really early so there was a place to park and little foot traffic up the trail. It was beautiful! Not too long and we saw a moose! Very cool.
Excellent little trail. Quite popular though so it can be packed at times.
Good hike-not too challenging but there is a spot that requires going down a small rock wall. Falls are neat!
Nice hike, some rock scaling at the end to reach the falls and cave.  Wear good shoes!

Very short hike perfect if you have kids and want to get outside.  The falls and scenery are beautiful. 

The trail does experience high traffic so I recommend getting an early start.
Very short and crowded. Still worth a look. fun to snow shoe at night. If you go please carry out your trash. It was a little cluttery the last time we were there.
Awesome, love hiking to waterfalls, this ones one of my favorites!
It was easy, it wasn't challenging, but it was fun to explore.
Really quick, and easy trail. Nice little waterfall in the spring. You can climb up to the cave at the end of the trail, and it's pretty cool.

This is a nice little trail and fairly busy. I parked in the parking lot next to the highway/main road so it took me a little while longer than what the suggested time was but it was a great way to spend part of an afternoon.
Short and easy
Fun short hike that's good to do in the winter time. It's fun climbing the frozen waterfall, but be careful. Can get extremely slippery
Fun and easy snowshoeing trail in winter. Good for the kids

"Easy" is definitely an accurate rating (which is what I was looking for), but the trail that leads to the falls was poorly marked, which led to a lot of wrong-turns for myself and several others. The falls themselves were pretty, but by 11am there were literally dozens of groups funneling into the area. A very crowded hike.

With how popular this hike was portrayed I expected a much different ending.  The kid-friendly trail ends at a a river and more advanced hiking begins if you want to actually see the falls.  Not wowed by this hike at all.

Super popular trail. It's kid friendly & I would honestly consider it a stroll in the park. We made it up to the base of the falls in 15. Depending how the water is, know that you'll (most likely) get your feet wet. Climbing up to the falls was a little tricky because I had no traction on my shoes whatsoever, but I made it just fine. The waterfall is pretty neat, I expected it to be bigger, but nonetheless it was cool.

I've done this hike about 3 times. Once last year with about 15 people ages 1 all the way to 60. We didn't go right up to the falls because we did have quite a few kids with us, and getting right into it is a bit tasking. The second was in April and there was still snow on the ground. We got about half way and had to turn back. The third was with my 15 year old nephew in June and WOW. What a cool waterfall. It's a must if you live here or are even just visiting.

Make sure and climb up to the actual donut hole where you hunch down and enter a cave where the water comes through the top. Inside the cave you can stand to the side and not get wet. It's beautiful and unique.
Great view at the end!  Perfect weather, quite a few people on the trail but everyone was friendly

Pretty easy trail! Don't be frightened by the sign that says "do not climb the waterfall" because it's totally doable and safe as long as you take your time and are wearing shoes that won't slide on rocks.  It's also totally worth the climb once you get to the top :)
Amazing and good for all ages!
Short & sweet. Awesome view from inside the donut.
Easy and great for a quick hike to show off the Rockies to any visitors!
A short and easy hike with a pretty waterfall at the end.  If you're looking for the greatest reward for the least amount of work, Donut Falls is a great option.
Easy hike, pretty falls, all in all very pleasant.
Great there needs to be s sign for it though on the main road as well as signs on the trail. Hard to figure it out when its you first time toy can get lost
Good hike if you're not really a hiker.
Nice and easy hike, great escape from he summer heat. Easy enough for kids had our 8 and 4 year old. Hiked up the fall to the cave, was worth it just be careful and smart.

Beautiful canyon.  Very crowded hike on a Saturday.  Don't expect solitude.  Good trail for kids, but not infants. Destination is NOT the actual falls, unless you are willing to do some dangerous rock climbing.  There is one dangerous moment scaling down rocks...especially with small children.  I would not recommend anyone younger than 12 climbing to the actual falls unless accompanied by an adult.
Nice hike with young kids. Very busy trail.

Great family friendly hike! I've always seen photos of the donut but I never realized I had to hike up a water fall to get to it. 

To get to the actual donut, it looks intimidating but children were climbing with parental guidance.
Great hike, make sure you go inside and then up and over.
Great hike. Just have to make sure you know what path to take to get to falls. Steep, steep climb up waterfall to get to the donut at the end.
Very crowded, lots of congestion and confusion about how to get close to the falls. Beautiful hike, tho, and fun to do with the kids.

One of the most popular waterfall hikes in the Salt Lake area. It is common to share the this short trail with over one hundred other hikers, especially on weekends. We always go on a weekday around 8am and we usually only see a handful of people. The trail to the bottom of the falls is very easy. It is recommended to stay at the bottom of the waterfall runoff. Signs are posted to not proceed past the runoff due to the fact that serious injury could occur when hiking to Donut Falls. If you choose to hike up the rocks and water to get to the cave where Donut Falls drops into, do not take children. Also, do not attempt to take a trail to the left of the falls. In the last couple of years a couple of people have fallen and died while scrambling the steep rocky face. 

For directions, trip information, and photos from Donut Falls, visit http://www.yourhikeguide.com/donut-falls/
Beautiful forest on the hike up, but making it to the base of the falls was too difficult with a little kid strapped to my back.

Most part of this hike in unshaded. Sunscreen sunscreen sunscreen please. 

Parking lot is small. Could probably just accommodate 10-12 cars (not sure. maybe more). There are signs that says no parking on the side of the dirt road but people still park there anyway.  But you don't just copy whatever knowing its not right, be patient to wait for somebody leaving to get a spot at the designated parking. it's a short hike so people come and go.

This is very good for a family hike so you can bring our little ones along -- that is if you do not have any plans on going to the top to witness the beautiful donut falls. the first part of the hike is very easy. you will see a lot of little kids hiking and enjoying it. its not steep nor rock. you'll have to cross the stream to get to a good resting place at the bottom of the falls. so again, prepared to get your feet wet. My friends and I make sure that we have our flip flops in our hiking bags so we can soak our tired feet on the ice cold water. 

When you get to the bottom of the falls you'd be wondering where the donut falls is like what you see on pictures! Well, this is where the hard part of the hike comes. you will have to hike through the rocks to get to the top of the falls then you will see the majestic donut falls. this is not just a rocky hike okay...rocks could be sharp and slippery since water from the top is streaming down. if you do not want your shoes/feet to get wet, you can opt to go up through the rocks on the side of the falls but i figured its more difficult if you are not an experienced hiker. after a few slips and bumps, i got to the very top and i was in awe. it was all worth the slips and bumps. 

Most people would not take the risk of going at the top. but you have to. what's the sense of going to donut falls if you won't see the donut right?  But again, going to the top is not a hike for little kids. it could be dangerous.

Travel. Hike. Enjoy.

There is a fork in the trail early on that isn't marked, so we ended up taking the wrong way and hiked double what we should have, which was kind of unpleasant. Also, this is a popular hike so there are often lines to get through the trail and to the falls. But the waterfall is really beautiful.

Easy hike. We hiked it with a 3 month old in a front carrier. It's worth getting wet to make it into the cave to see the falls. 
Parking on the weekends is a challenge. It'll be tempting to park on the road where it says "no parking" but don't do it. I saw many cars get ticketed.
Fast and easy.  Good trail for young ones
So fun!! Took my four little kids, and it was the perfect length and level for us all to enjoy!
Not challenging, but the falls are awesome!
Go during a weekday morning or else it's packed. Super short hike

First time there last week and tried climbing above the water fall and the wall came apart. Fell 8ft into the river and nearly went into the donut hole. 
Tore my hand open so I ruined our family trip there by 
leaving early to get 16 stitches. Plan to return tomorrow tho. 
Ruined my phone in the river so I lost my pics while at the fall. 
Needless to say, don't try to climb above that water fall lol. 

Regardless it was awesome and loved it there. Pics of my cool injury uploaded :)
We have done this hike twice and love it. Easy enough to take the kids along with us!
Short hike, beautiful. Nice trails, but not well marked and very crowded.

Nice trail path until you get to the stream that leads to the falls. Unless youre ok with getting wet feet, you'll be hugging the wall for a bit.  Tough climb to get up to the actual Donut Falls site if your inexperienced. Worth it though. Cool looking falls.

Donut Falls is worth the scramble up the boulder field to stand in the cave as the water pours in around you. To share the moment with my seven year old daughter was one I won't soon forget!  Her effort and courage were commendable!
Good
Super easy, super crowded, it's a good quick hike
Very easy. Excellent for kids. A lot of people tho..

Very easy hike.  The kids took every single side trail they could come up with, just to break a sweat.  A bit crowded on weekends, but at least more and more people are outdoors!  If you are going all the way up, there is a very good chance your feet will get wet.
Nice little hike with lots of people on the trail.
Gorgeous, family fun for all ages and levels.
One of my favorite hikes in the Salt Lake area. Super easy and not too long. And the waterfall at the end is rad!

Pretty easy trail for the most part. If you go right at the fork it will take to some upper trails (not always marked) but if you stick close to the sound of the creek you'll soon find yourself up above the falls looking down.

Very fun! Great hike for all ages!!!
The fall was beautiful. Short technical hike to get to the donut but worth every step!

Great! Went with my 5 kids ages 8-9 months and I only carried the 9 month old. Not too busy when we got there at 9:40am, but REALLY busy when we left at 11:45 (we went much slower than normal people because of the three year old and all of the breaks for watching prairie dogs). Great family hike!

Fun, but pretty crowded. It is a totally family-friendly hike. One little part of climbing down to rock before you get to the falls it's just challenging enough for little kids to have fun. Those who are saying it's not family-friendly when you climb the falls, well you're not supposed to climb the falls. It's a dangerous thing to do as climbing waterfalls always is a dangerous thing to do. There are signs warning against it. So enjoy the view of the falls and the fun wading at the bottom.

They really need to put up signs directing you to the falls. The trail splits off two different ways, twice. It's kid friendly only to the bottom of the falls. It was way over crowded, and going any further seemed too risky.
Good kid friendly hike. Plenty to see.
Very nice, easy hike (until the waterfall). Great climb if you're up for it. Nice picture spots. We would do it again.
Great

We did this trail last Saturday. It was absolutely beautiful and I loved it, although really crowded. It was a very easy hike until we got to the falls part. I wouldn't call this part of the hike family friendly. Maybe it was the time of year, but there was still lots of water coming down, and the hike up the waterfall is steep and rocky. You have to wade through water to get there. I saw at least 3 children crying over scuffed up knees, and that evening on the news we saw that someone had fallen and gotten stuck on the rocks, and had to wait there overnight to be life flighted out the next morning. Last year a woman died by falling 100 feet down the falls. So pretty, yes; family friendly, maybe not.

Like others have said, short and easy 30-40 minute round trip! Towards the beginning, there is a split on the trail. The trail going left leads to donut falls and the trail to the right is more uphill and takes about an hour n a half to get up there to some pretty cool mines and stuff
This was a fun, easy hike. I was sad when it was over so we hiked a few more miles beyond the falls. Beautiful!

Fun simple trail. If you want to climb the falls you have to wait until later in the year. At this point the water is running pretty hard and seems pretty dangerous. Still pretty to look at and only about 35 minutes round trip.

The donut part is broken. It collapsed a few years ago.
Other then that it was a great hike for kids and families. I have a 5 & 4 year old who did really well. 
We went on Saturday at about 11:30 ish. It was busy but not like standing in line. We were always moving and had lots of fun. 
We also parked down off the main road. It was a little bit of a walk to get to the trailhead. 
The top go the hike you are very likely to get your feet wet.
Pretty trail but over crowded with people. Good for beginners
It is busy but fun trail. If you are just getting use to altitude start with an easy trail like this one. The falls are wonderful.
It's a really easy, fun trail in a beautiful setting. Great for kids, dates, or a quick morning run.
Amazing!! I want to go back
Great hike.
Freezing water but the whole family made it.
Good first hike for kids.

This hike was a nice afternoon hike. Easy and beautiful views. Very family friendly. Seemed like a busy and popular spot so we were happy that we parked on the highway instead of driving to the trailhead, where parking was limited.
Nice and easy good for beginners
quick easy and short. great for the little ones.

Hiked to Donut Falls Wednesday evening just after a rain storm.  The pine and aspen forests were wet and fresh and green.  Water over the falls was running heavy and made for a spectacular sight.  I think the trail descibed here starts from the main Millcreek Canyon road.  However, you can now drive to the trailhead parking lot, which makes the hike to the falls a 1.8 mile round trip.  The hike is very, very popular and the evening that I did it, parking was scarse and there were too many folks on the trail for my liking.  Otherwise it is a pleasant outing for all abilities.
Loved this hike even though I didn't climb down the rocks just before the falls, i was wearing my son in a new frame backpack. Once I'm more comfortable with it, we'll try again!

I would consider this a walk, not really a hike, unless you scramble up the falls.  The falls were nice and the upper parts were not very crowded, since people were afraid of getting their feet wet.  The water was definitely cold, but was a small price to pay for a better view.  The parking is very limited and they were handing out tickets like candy.  There are other falls that are almost as impressive without the huge crowds.

Even on a Monday evening, it was like Grand Central Station.  Totally packed at the trailhead and it seemed like every car had at least 4 people in it.  Large groups and some of them not all that courteous in terms of trail etiquette.

You can't get to the Donut yet, without getting your feet wet.  Maybe in a few weeks, but I'd skip this trail for now, unless you plan on getting there early in the morning or don't mind crowds.
A short but really fun hike!
Beautiful and easy hike. Good for little children.
Easy, short hike. I did it while 7 months pregnant, and had no problem. Wear shoes that can get wet, as crossing the water and climbing the waterfall is worth it.
ME & my 8 month Pregnant wife went up and loved it super easy
An easy, short hike with a fun reward at the end.  Hikers can explore the river and climb up near the waterfall if you've got the right shoes on!  Would recommend for anyone!

Made the mistake of Going on a
Saturday. It was like a super hwy!  Nice and easy Til the last but which requires crossing water cross covered rocks.
Decent hike. A little busy. Rude hikers. Cool view of the "donut"
LOVE this hike. Gorgeous hike & totally worth it. Gourgeous cave too! Definitely one of my favorites.
Quick easy trail, it can get pretty muddy and slippery when it's rained recently. I recommend wearing shoes or sandals that can get wet if you want to climb the up to the waterfall.
Fun hike. Bring some water resistant shoes to cross the streams.
Fun & easy, it's a great hike if you're just looking for a short hike for the day.

Great hike, can get busy but still worth it, also a fun hike in the winter the trail gets packed down enough to the point you don't need snowshoes. And don't forget to actual check out the waterfall in the cave I missed it the first time because I didn't hike up the rocks.

Went up in March. There was tons of snow, but it was packed tight and our group with running shoes did just find with minimal slippage. It was a bit hazardous but a complete blast! The falls has way less water than when we went again in May. You have to walk a bit on a residential road through some cabins till you get to the actual trail but its not a problem. (Not sure when they actually open that gate).
This trail is very busy. Even at 10:00am on a random Tuesday we saw 20+ people. While everyone is generally courteous I prefer other trails where I can hear less talking from random highschoolers sluffing school.
Lots of tight packed snow on the ground in March. Pleasant trail.
First time to hike this area.  It was my Birthday and I had heard a lot about it.  A very bust trail compared to what am use to, but a great one all the same.
Very fun short little hike. A decent rock scramble mixed w snow around the rocks this time  of year (early May)
Short, simple hike. Great for kids. The hike has a pretty view of Mt. Kessler, ends at the bottom of the rather small Donut Falls.

Ok. NO ONE told us that to see the actual "Donut Falls" of this hike, you have to scramble up a steep stream. Gah! Most of the families just had to sit at the bottom and enjoy the pretty view from there (you can't see the donut fall from there though). This is why we started a hiking site for families called Wanderookie. We test the trails ourselves then write posts with pics, trail details (parking, difficulty, crowds etc.) that will minimize surprises for families or rookie adventurers. The falls on this hike are truly unique and beautiful, but be prepared to scramble up the stream! We will be doing this hike with our alltrails hiking group (also on Facebook under Utah Hiking Group - Wanderookie) this summer! Find us and join! It will be a blast!
A short easy hike. Usually crowded. Much prefer the trail on the right that takes you further up the canyon.
Nice easy hike and a beautiful waterfall at the end.  Too short and too easy to do again but enjoyed the scenery.

Beautiful trail to hike in October. The trail was not too busy as I started around 6:30pm, but there were a few people I crossed at different points. I went up and over where the falls are and was able to enjoy the sounds of the creek and falls alone. There is one split in the trail that is not well marked. Keep to the left to reach the falls.

This is a great simple Family hike. Although, as has been mentioned by many others it is extremely busy, we have completed a couple times (all on the weekend) and has always been very busy. We've found if you go up the backside coming out of the parking lot, it is prettier going along side the river and that section much less traveled.
This is a fun hike, but very crowded, especially on the weekends.  It kind of feels like you're in Disneyland instead of enjoying the quiet of nature.
Nice short easy hike for Adult but not for children.

Not my favorite hike but it is an easy hike for adults. I wouldn't recommend taking any kids along esp right after winter because of the water run and how dangerous it can get with the rocks. Enjoyed climbing all the way up to the donut hole. It is a little crowded if you go during the noon hours but usually very quiet and serene when your the first ones there in the AM! I'd go again just for the fun of it.

definitely not recommended for children but as sisters going up to the top of the falls, was so beautiful! went inside and actually stood under the waterfall coming thru the hole, (donut falls) pretty freakin awesome! hiked this trail about 15 times this summer. EASY and WORTH IT!

Just went there on August 31st and with it being Labor Day, the trail up to donut falls was super busy. It was pretty though. At some point in the hike, there's different paths you can take, but they don't lead up to the falls. In my opinion though, taking the path(s) less traveled by(literally) was the best part. Definitely a lot longer of a hike as well as a steeper incline. There's pretty meadows along the way and if you walk further(if you take the right paths that is) you'll eventually end up in this really nice area to picnic as well as take pictures. Explore the different paths if you're looking for serenity and/or a longer, little bit more challenging hike because these other paths don't have a ton of people. Keep in mind though, again, these alternative paths won't lead up to the falls. At least, not that I know of.

Excellent for taking small kids on a small adventure.  If you park up the road about a mile then the hike is less than 2 miles round-trip (this road is closed in the winter).  Parking at the upper trail head is very limited so some choose to park at the lower trail head.
Don't take your dog!  Got a nice ticket after the rangers chased us up.
Extremely easy hike, but the falls are beautiful! Fun to do if you aren't looking for a serious workout.

We loved this hike(25 and 32 yr old women in shape with an awesome 9 yr old boy) There were tons of chipmunks on the trail and a moose was spotted off the trail not but 25 yards!! There were more people than I was hoping for on the trail but it's very popular and it was the weekend so I can't fault it for that... Just try to go on a weekday if possible. Hike was a breeze! Even if your not in shape, take your time and enjoy the scenery!

NO DOGS ALLOWED! We did not enjoy this hike. We drove all the way from Provo to do this hike not realizing that dogs are not allowed on this trail or anywhere in Big Cottonwood Canyon. The view of the falls was disappointing, hidden by an outcropping of rock that you had to climb to see around. Not possible with little kids. The walk was nice but also too crowded.

Short, fun hike to a pretty cool waterfall. The trail is pretty easy, but the last little bit is a challenge. In order to get to the doughnut portion of the falls you have to climb up some rocks. It is a little tricky and can get quite slick depending on the amount of water coming through the falls, but it was worth the climb. I wouldn't recommend that young kids try and make the climb.

Fun trail.  I have done this many times, in winter and in summer.  Trail is fairly easy to follow, however, please use extreme caution when scrambling up the last bit to the cave itself.  This can be difficult for adults and ill advised for young children.  People get hurt here every year, some have been killed.  Use good judgement and have fun!

Pros:  Accessible, fun for kids (8 and up is OK, 7 and below, use caution) Interesting feature, north facing (not as hot) 
Cons: Incredibly popular, can be dangerous.
Great hike for the kids - relatively easy, not too long. Gets slippery at the falls but with care the kiddos made it across.
Love this hike. Generally see a moose. Not today but we will be back!
Completed Yesterday the 25th of July. Did not see a moose but the trail is beautiful. I hiked this trail a while back and saw a large bull. A great short easy trail.
Super easy, short hike with a pretty waterfall at the end!
Fun and easy hike. Super kid friendly, wide and well marked trail, plenty of other hikers, and easy to finish in a couple hours. My son and I make it our inaugural hike every spring.
Love this easy hike. The falls are beautiful. Only downside is it can be a bit crowded. Have to get your feet wet to get near the falls. Can be slippery, be careful.

Enjoyable first hike of the season for me.  I have never been before, but have had it on my to do list for a while.  Finally went on 6/22 and found it a nice easy hike with very wide trails.  Very heavy traffic, and the miles zipped by quickly.  We did have to park down by the main road as parking can be limited at the trail head at times.  It adds a bit more to the hike but not bad.  I saw lots of toddlers and small children.  Seemed like a good family destination.  A word of caution when you are crossing the river near the top.  footing can be slipper in the water so watch the little ones, I was a little surprised to see babies and toddlers up past the river.  I managed to get across the river dry, my hiking partner not so well.  Fun, but expect to get wet especially if you go to the very top. Enjoy!
Super easy hike for any and all ages and activity levels. It's beautiful but there are always lots of people and the trail is not pet friendly.

Nice little hike.  Nothing terribly difficult.  The thing is, people feel compelled to climb the falls, which are very slippery.  Someone just died in a fall there a week ago.  It might seem harmless but beware.   Good for kids and adults alike, hardly any elevation gain.

There is a way to Cardiff Mines from this trail.  It's a few miles longer but well worth it.   Refer to your maps.

Went yesterday. It wasn't packed but there was road construction driving up big cottonwood, so it took us about 40 extra minutes either direction. Also, my pedometer said it was about 1.7mi round trip. Easy and gorgeous, but not as long as I expected!

Granted we did it on Memorial Day weekend, it was way too crowded for my taste-from the parking lot all the way to the falls, which we had to view from above because of the log-jam of people trying to get to the bottom of the falls. 

Also, the trail to the falls is not marked very well.  We ended up overshooting the falls and having to back-track to get back onto the trail.  While it was fun for my 6-year old daughter, having allTrails rate this as the best hike in Utah is not even close to accurate.
Nice hike and beautiful scenery.  The water is a little too high right now.  I will go again in a couple weeks to hike up to the top.
My first hiking place nice went you get to the end and see water fall could not go up were the cave was but is okay I like the water fall
Awesome waterfall, always packed with people and their kids.
I couldn't find it?
There is still lots of snow in the first week of May though most of it was packed well enough to hike on. I went on a Friday around noon and the trail was fairly crowded.
Just went today. I would describe it as more than a little bit of snow, but still a good hike. Definitely want to go back after the snow melts. Better in the summer.
Still had a little snow on the ground but not to bad for hiking was fun little trail...

My family and I have hiked here twice. It's a very pretty trail but it was crowded both times. People are usually polite on the trail but maybe hike it during the week if you want to take pics w/out strangers in them.
Hiked this trail today, still had snow on the ground, but it was not too slippery. Wonderful hike.

Fun hike. It's an easy hike, although me & my friend took a detour from the orginal trial (that's the adventurers in us I guess.) Lots of people travel this trail so if your looking to get away into the wood for peace and quite this wouldn't be the place. Fun overall the the trial has a waterfall &  cave both cool features to this easy hike.
Lots of fun, went with a church group to hike this trail. I would recommend it although it was a very crowded trail.
Easy hike with little kids (all under 5).  Very crowded and not relaxing with all of the people on the trail- hence the 4/5.
Did this again but climbed up rocks to Donut waterfall cave this time. Was really cool & worth the effort!!

Super easy my kids all loved it. Ages 8-15 VERY pretty and peaceful we were on the trail by 8:00 In The morning so we had it pretty much to our selves. Coming back it was a different story tons of people ! Will do this one again for sure !

this is a great short hike with young kids.  My 5 and 3 year old walked it and I carried my 7 month old - just when the kids are about to melt down you come to the waterfall :)  we went on a week day, could see how it would be busy on a weekend, but worth it for a family looking for a short hike.  This hike offers a little climb and a good end so the kids feel accomplished.
Nice hike when you don't have a lot of time

Easy hike after work. Not many folks on the trail in the evening. Beautiful, shady hike with lots of wildlife nearby. The falls are nice, but I would try to do this hike after the rain (a scarcity I know).

The top of the trail is really beautiful, and it's about as easy as it gets for a hike but bring your patience. This place is REALLY CROWDED. I read the reviews and thought to myself, it couldn't be that bad.... It's that bad. If you have kids and you're looking for an easy hour or two outdoors, this place is for you. If you are looking for a quiet place to commune with nature, this is not it. Go somewhere else.
This was a great hike for my two boys ages 3 & 5. Too hard to climb up the falls part with them but I saw lots of adults doing it.

For fun times with the kids, we love this hike! We go every year and the kids love it. It's not steep at all, the walk in is fun, the kids love the bridge over the water.. and the fun little drop down right before getting to the water fall is "so scary" for the kids, yet they love it!    Don't park where it says, no parking, Everytime we go, we see the rangers giving tickets.  They patrol it like crazy.  Worth parking over by the main road and walking up the road to the trail head.
Nice easy trail. Not very steep. To get to the waterfall / cave you have to climb up some rocks so some good sandals aren't a bad idea.

Drive south off of BCC road and save yourself a good half mile of hiking. 

Kids (11 & 9) LOVED the scrambling near the waterfall.
There's a path you can take that'll lead you to an area where you can look at the top of the donut. Kinda cool, the view is nice too.

Hiked to the falls with my two grandsons ages 6 and 10. The parking lot was full and the trail busy. Probably about a 100 people on the trail and at the falls on this day.  It has been decades since I have made this hike the the falls is not the same as there used to be more of a cave at the front of the falls. My grandsons had a ball and of course had to get wet which was the best part of the whole day. The trail is a gradual climb with a short climb down a 12 foot rock escarpment.

This trail is very easy but so amazing at the end! Why?! Cause its got a bomb cave with a waterfall that comes down into it, that's why! The climb up to the cave is sweet too. Great for kids to play in the creek and hang out. The cave is for older kids that can climb and not afraid of heights. Fun stuff!

My 15 year old step-daughter and I took this hike and really enjoyed it. We took an accidental "detour" however by heading right at the fork instead of going left, so we ended up on a much longer and more difficult hike which we really enjoyed. We went back the other way to the falls on our way back and the falls were beautiful. Parking wasn't great, but I can see why this is such a heavily travelled hike. We look forward to going back!

Very cool hike up to this waterfall with the hole. Very congested with others and small children. Donut hole is worth seeing with a little extra effort and there is a small cave you can climb into to see the waterfall up close inside the cave.

This was our first time hiking up here, the water was really cold and there was still snow on the higher, shadier areas. It wasn't that bad of a hike, we were unprepared as well. We were in flip flops and still made it up this trail just fine. It is actually one of my favorite hikes now.

We did this hike today.  My 5 year old, who usually complains about hiking, hiked the entire way telling me what a fun hike it was.  Right now the river is low enough, the kids can play in it.  They loved it.  It was very crowded and that was on a wed. afternoon.

Went during early March while there was still snow up there.  It was our first time hiking it and we were a little confused when the GPS ended on a giant hill with no waterfall in sight.  We could hear the fall though and hiked up the hill a little bit and realized we were actually on the waterfall.  There was an awesome cave like thing we were able to climb down into.  Beautiful hike and fairly easy.

Easy hike, great when time is limited or a group member needs a less strenuous climb. The views are spectacular no matter the time of year. If busy trails and crowded overlooks are not your thing, this is not the hike you're seeking.

Hiked this trail with my 6yo daughter and she loved it. It's short enough with not much elevation gain so she didn't need to stop and rest or be carried. The parking was pretty packed with a lot of people on the trail, but not too bad. We sat on a rock in the middle of the steam at the foot of the falls and "caught" Swedish fish. There was plenty of shade most of the trail so it was nice and cool and provided for some fun scenery. We didn't boulder up the falls. A little to dangerous for a tiny girl. All said and done, it was a fun little hike and will do it again and hopefully go to the top of the falls.

Fun quick hike but gets kinda crowded! There was snow on the trail today but since so many people come through the snow is packed down so it's still an easy trail. It's good for family and children because its not very steep. The waterfall and cave are awesome! :)
Nice hike, but it gets very crowded.
great hike, pretty treacherous in winter right below the falls. a lot of ice covered boulders and such.
jumping

Big cottonwood has a myriad of trails of all levels. Only downside of the canyon is no dogs are allowed ): 

Donut Falls is beautiful! Short and not challenging. We did climb up past the Falls and followed the stream a little bit, which was a fun adventure.

Nice short hike and well worth it.  Bring your camera. 
It's easy to miss the turn off back to the parking area but the main dirt road will take you back close enough to find it.
Beautiful hike, fun climbing, and cool falls. Can get crowded by lunch time so go early.

It's a great hike for small children I ended up going past the donut and there were several more little water falls very small it's a good little hike I would recommend it for dates and family's, if your looking for something advanced this one is definately not it. -kailor

Great mini hike for kids and toddlers in carriages. I have biked the trail above Donut Hole Falls and it was a challenge for both me and my bike. Lots of carrying the bike around obstacles. 

But Donut Hole Falls is a wonderful place to relax.

Really neat waterfall at the end! There's a hole in the ceiling of a cave with the stream falling right through the hole making an awesome view! Make sure you go to the back portion of the cave and behind the falls, and take a picture. It's deep enough you'll get your pants wet up to your knees doing this, but the picture you'll get will be so worth it! (with the sun coming through the hole at the same time the water does!)

Not much of a hike, quite short and not very steep (until the very very end). However, right at the end you'll have to climb up a bunch of rock boulders, and in some places water running over them may make parts of it slippery, so it may not be a good idea to bring really young children.
Fun out and back trip with a great waterfall at the end, but very crowded.

The waterfall is beautiful! It's a quick easy hike, great for families. I recently moved out here and took my family there when they visited. I've been back there 2x on days off when I was bored. On weekends the falls are packed with people, I'd recommend hiking it during the week if possible.

This is a short and sweet waterfall. Everyone of all ages can do this hike. There are more waterfalls and picture taking views if you climb the boulders which is a bit more strenuous. You may also take a dirt trail uphill which is on the side of the bushes. The day I came was super busy (Saturday). It is best to park outside of the trail and walk about a half mile in. There's also tons of potholes and a big dip to be careful of if u decide to drive in and look for parking.
Love the falls on this short hike

Very easy hike for all ages.  Even though the grotto/cavern partially collapsed a few years ago, it is still possible to hike up the face of the waterfall and see the water cascade into the donut hole.  If you stay below, you'll miss the view.
nice
Easy hike and good for the family.

I agree with Angie, the falls are just ordinary now. 

It is a pleasant hike and well worth taking the kids. 

Parking lot was overflowing for a Tuesday morning! Quite a few folks on the trail, but spread out. Several were climbing up the boulders to see the Donut Hole.
Nice trail year round. We went snowshoeing. There are better hiking trails up SLC's canyons, but if you have the time Donut Falls is definitely worth it.
Nice all ages trail year round.
great trail good for young familes  nice views
Great fun for kids. Nice hike. Lots of photo opportunities. Parking can be a pain at peak times.
Nice short hike.  North face of the canyon, so it stay pleasant most of the year.  Fun hike for small children, but watch them carefully near the falls.

Yeah, was actually able to hike in today due to the lack of snow right now up the canyon. I did have to hike in from the main road because the road to the trailhead is closed for the winter. Once I got to the falls area there was ice there so be careful. Also had to climb down a little ledge that was very slick so be ready for that if you go up soon. But it was a fun little January hike that probably normally wouldn't happen.

This was a great hike with lots of opportunities for pictures. I'm a little out of shape so this was a nice starting hike. The first little bit is pretty uphill and can be tough if altitude affects you or you have asthma but it gets a lot easier after the first hill. You should be fine if you don't have trouble breathing normally. The falls are also definitely worth the little hike!
Great for families, however the final climb up to the falls can be difficult.  If you can make it up the climb at the end it is well worth it.

Went with lots of family members.  Was a great trip for the age range we had with us (12 to 71).  Ate some snacks at the base of the falls.  There were lots of people there.  Didn't climb to the doughnut due to the group ages.

Came here a year ago June with my daughters and it was less crowded, but snow covered half the ground.  We were not prepared.  Also, the run-off was so strong we couldn't really see the doughnut area.
what a great, quick hike! Easy slopes leading up to the falls then some fun scrambling to get to the falls itself. I only wish we could bring our dog on this hike.
Hard to believe this little gem is just 30 mins drive from SLC. Easy & fun, and gorgeous now with all the wildflowers blooming.

We really love this hike to get away from the valley on the hot days of summer.  It is an excellent trail to bring kids on and we really like to bring friends from out of town to show them our beautiful mountains.  Make sure to pack a lunch and spend some time along the trail and enjoy just how pretty it is up here.

Great trail for the kids. Still a little snow and mud in places but nothing horrible. The river was high and fast so we had to hold our kids on the bridge crossing but other than that the trail keeps a good distance from the river. The shade in the canyon was a nice break from the 90+ degree weather in the valley. We'll take our kids again. Kids are 5 and 3 and they did the while thing on their own which was nice, usually we end up carrying them.

I love this hike it's so beautiful up there and it's great for all skill levels to hike, my four year old almost made it the whole way.  At the end there is a nice waterfall that falls through a hole in a rock hence the name donut falls.
Nice easy hike. Good for all members of the family
Nice little walk to a medium/smaller size water fall. But with it being so close to everyday life its a good quick get away.

I took my 8-year-old daughter on this little stroll. It was a delightful walk completely within her ability range. The creek and the lush mountain vegetation made the walk very pleasant. A great way to expose little ones to the joys of hiking.
